 = I[MASK]dependie[MASK]te ( Ricardo Arjona album ) = 
 
 Independiente is the thirteent[MASK] Spanish @-@ [MASK]anguage studio album by Gua[MASK]emalan singer @-@ song[MASK]riter Ricardo Arjona , released on 23 September 2011 . Recorded in the United States and Mexico , it was produced by Arjona with Dan Warner , Lee Levin and Puerto Rican singer @-@ songwriter Tommy Torres . The album — the first independent release by Arjona af[MASK]er he was signed by Sony Music in 1993 and Warner Music in [MASK]0[MASK]8 — was issued by his own label ,[MASK]Metamorfosis . 
 Co[MASK]posed and written in a y[MASK]ar , the record marks Arjona and Torres ' fourth collaboration . For Inde[MASK]endiente , Arjona returns to his trademark sound after his s[MASK]ylistic departure for Poquita Ropa ( 2010 ) . W[MASK]ile p[MASK]od[MASK]cing[MASK]the lat[MASK]er [MASK] he had used fewer instruments to simplify his sound , having introduced what had been called a " stripped @-@ down acoustic effort " in his music . Independiente has been comp[MASK]red to his earlier recordings ,[MASK]Historias ( 1994 ) and Animal Nocturno ( 1993 ) . 
 Independiente became [MASK]rjona 's fourth number @-@ one album on the Billboard Top Latin Albums where it de[MASK]uted for the week ending 22 October 2011 . Fo[MASK] thirteen non @-@ consecutive weeks it topped the Latin Pop A[MASK]bum[MASK] chart , and reached number one on the Mexic[MASK]n Albums Chart . It is his fifth consecutive album to chart on the Billboard[MASK]200 ( reaching number sixty @-@ five ) [MASK] and his fourth a[MASK]bum to chart in Spain ( peaking at number [MASK]ixty @-@ eight ) . Within one week after its releas[MASK] Independiente was certified gold in C[MASK]ile , t[MASK]e United States an[MASK] Mexico and certified platinum in Venezuela and Argentina . 
 Five singles have be[MASK]n released from the alb[MASK]m . The lead single , " El Amor " , became a commercial success in several Latin American c[MASK]untries and was [MASK]umber one on the Billboard La[MASK]in Songs and Latin Pop Songs charts . It was followed [MASK]y " Fuiste Tú " ( featuring G[MASK]by Moreno ) , which reached number one on the Lati[MASK] Pop Songs , number two on the Latin Songs charts and topped several other national charts . " Mi Novia Se Me Está Poniendo Vieja " was released in May 2012 ; " Te Quiero " in Ju[MASK]y 2012 , and " Si Tu No Existieras " in November 2012 . To promote Independiente , Arjona[MASK]embarke[MASK] on his Metamorfosis World Tour . 
 
 = = Backg[MASK]ound = = 
 
 In 2010 , [MASK]rjona wanted to change hi[MASK] m[MASK]sical style ; after experimenting with using as few instruments as possible , he obtained a sound similar to an a capella per[MASK]orman[MASK]e ( sim[MASK]lifying hi[MASK] sound ) and introduced what he called a " stripped @-@ down acoustic effort [MASK] to his music . This was heard on his twelfth studio album , Poquita Ropa . Arjona produced[MASK]the album with Dan W[MASK]rner , who has worked with Shakira , Celine [MASK]ion and Christina Agu[MASK]lera .[MASK]When promoting the album Arjona said , " [MASK] songs ] are like women ; they get[MASK]things up and are so concerned about this that they forget[MASK]that the less clothes , more beauty . The songs ar[MASK] often overwhelmed by ourselves , because we saturate[MASK]the[MASK] with arrangements looking to exalt their qualities an[MASK] we e[MASK]d up hiding them " . Poquita Ropa became t[MASK]e first album since Adentro which Arjona recorded with[MASK]ut Torres . 
 Weeks before the release of Independiente , Arjona iss[MASK]ed a letter[MASK]raising the issue of his[MASK][MASK]ast relationships with[MASK]recording compa[MASK]ies . He revealed the cir[MASK]u[MASK]stances of [MASK]is first contract : " a produce[MASK] , fri[MASK]nd of mine , told them [ the rec[MASK]rd label ] that if they did not sign me in , [MASK]hey won 't sign two artists he had [ at that time ] "[MASK]. Arjona[MASK]further explained that he received the " minimum royalty percentage " from his most success[MASK]ul albums . Independiente is Arjona 's first ind[MASK]pendent release through his own label : Metamorfosis , a company he created to refocus his career . The company is presided by Arjona and several friends ( incl[MASK]ding photograph[MASK]r @-@ director Ricardo Calderón , Universa[MASK] Music México execut[MASK]ve Humberto Calderon and BMG 's Miriam Sommerz ) , and [MASK]s based in Miami and Mexico City . [MASK]rjona[MASK]commented that his independence re[MASK]resented com[MASK]romise more than freedom , st[MASK]ting that " Inside the word ' Independent ' , even when it sounds like extreme freedom , there 's a big amount of compromise and the responsibility of being able to administrate , in the be[MASK]t way possible[MASK], such independence " . Billboard notes that , although other groups have relea[MASK]ed independen[MASK] albums following contracts with m[MASK]jor labels[MASK], Arjona is t[MASK]e most important Latin pop artist to do so . Although the album is marketed within the n[MASK]w label , distrib[MASK]tion was handle[MASK] by Warner Music . 
 
 = = Production and recording = = 
 
 Independiente marked Arjona 's fourth collaboration with Torres . T[MASK]e latter was a composer and producer , also receiving background @-@ vocal credit . The musicians first worked together in 2005 , when Arjona released hi[MASK] tenth studio album ( Adentro ) . He stated t[MASK]at he first " tested " Torres by sending him the " hookiest and darkest tracks " on the album : " Acompañame A [MASK]star Solo " and " Iluso " . Torres then " went all out on the first demo , hirin[MASK] a full band that included a string orchestra " . In Quién Dijo Ayer ( 2007 ) , T[MASK]rres produced [MASK]he singles " Quién " a[MASK]d "[MASK]Quiero " and provided backgrou[MASK]d vocals on the remastered versions of Arjona 's past hits . In 5to[MASK]Piso ( 2[MASK]08 ) , Torres produced several tracks ; one was the lead single " Como Duele " , considered Arjona 's " biggest [MASK]it in years " by Jason Birchmeier of Allmusic . 
 The album was composed over a one @-@ year period . Most of its production wa[MASK] [MASK]andled by three producers familiar with Arjona 's work : Dan Warner , Lee Levin and Dan Rudin . Tommy Torres also produced three tracks : the [MASK]ead single " E[MASK] Amor " , second single " Fu[MASK]ste Tú " and " Hay Amores " . Victor Patrón produced two songs , ( " Caudillo " and the piano version of " Mi Novia [MASK]e Me Está Poniendo Vieja " ) and Ju[MASK]io Ch[MASK]vez ai[MASK]ed in the p[MASK]oduction of " Reconciliación " . Arjona wrote all[MASK]the songs except " El Amor[MASK]" ( which was co @-@ written with Torres ) . The album was recorded and produced in several cities [MASK]n the United States and Mexico . Independiente was mixed at the Blue Grotto in Nashville , Tennessee , and mastered by Tom[MASK]Coyne and[MASK]Aya Merri[MASK]l at Sterling Sound [MASK]n New York City . With Torres ' return to producing Arjona regained the classic , trademark so[MASK]nd which Torres helped devel[MASK]p since 2005 . 
 
 = = Compos[MASK]tion[MASK]= = 
 
 Independien[MASK]e opens with " Lo Que[MASK]Está Bien Está Ma[MASK] " , a Latin pop song and the only track composed by Dan Warner instead of Arjona ( who wrote the lyrics ) . " El Amor " was moti[MASK]ated by Arjona 's desire to examine " those big , dark ev[MASK]nts within love that nobody talks about " ;[MASK]he contin[MASK]e[MASK] , "[MASK][ the ] dark sides of love are extremely fundamental to understand its great value . " Arjona[MASK]added , " So many good things a[MASK]oul[MASK] love has been shown that somebody had to turn it around and tell the bad ones " . In a February 2012 interview , Arjo[MASK]a stated that " El Amor " was the " most tawdry " song he had r[MASK]leased to date , explaining that their choice of the song was a " contradiction " because it was not " the song which could[MASK]better represent the entire album " . He descri[MASK]ed it as [MASK] very strong " and " a bit dark " . The single marked Arjona 's return to his signature , mainstream sound aft[MASK]r the Cuban music[MASK]influenced Poquita Ropa 's lead s[MASK]ngle " Puente " , a mixture of salsa and merengue which failed to make an impact in the United States . 
 The album includes " Fuiste Tú " , a duet with Guatemalan singer Gaby Moreno . Its instrumentation consists of piano , violin , g[MASK]itars , drums and other percussion . Although Arjona st[MASK]ted that he " had the possibilities to record this song with very[MASK]well kn[MASK]wn people " he expre[MASK]sed[MASK]hi[MASK] happiness with Moreno , revealing[MASK]that " the possibilities of doing it [MASK]ith her , for me , are a celebration " . He described Mo[MASK]eno as " incredibly talented " , a "[MASK]co[MASK]ntrywoman " and a " fantastic human being " . Arjona named " Fuist[MASK] Tú " as o[MASK]e of the most important son[MASK]s on the album . " Mi [MASK]ov[MASK]a Se Me Está Poniendo Vieja " took two years to complet[MASK] and Arjona dedicated i[MASK] to his mother , Noemí Morales . He stated that he wrote it " as a gift for my mom on Mother 's [MASK]ay " and that he thought " the idea of including [MASK]t on the album was very good " . As with his single " Señora D[MASK] Las Cuatro Decada[MASK] " ([MASK]on 1994 's Historias ) , at first he nev[MASK]r thought to include the song on an album . " Caudillo " evokes [MASK] the image of some friends " Arjona had at college ; he asserted that he "[MASK]appears constantly[MASK]there because sometimes we transform ourselves into a contradictio[MASK] of all those things we fought in those moments . It 's the history of a student leader that becomes a president " . A[MASK]jona dedicated th[MASK] album to his father , who died in 2011 .

 Ind[MASK]pendiente was certified platinum by the Ar[MASK]entine Chamber of[MASK]Phonograms and Videograms Prod[MASK]cers in recognition of 40 @,@ 000 copies[MASK]sold . It was also certified gold and platinum by the Mexican[MASK]Association of Produc[MASK]rs of Phonograms and Videogr[MASK]ms for 90 @,@ 000 c[MASK]pies shipped .[MASK]In the United States , Independiente was certified Latin platinum by the Reco[MASK]ding Industry Association of Ame[MASK]ica for 100 @,@ 000 copies shipped . In Venezuela , the album was certified d[MASK]uble platinum for more than 40 @,@ 000 copies sold . It[MASK]was certified gold in Chile for 5 @,@ 000 copies shipped , and in Colombia for 10 @,@ 000 copies sold . As of November 2012 , Independiente has sold 75 @,@ 000 copies in the United States . 
 
 = = Critical reaction and awards = = 
 
 David Jeffries[MASK]of A[MASK]lmusic gave the album a mildly positive review , citing Arjona 's return to his more mainstre[MASK]m style after the " stripped @-@ down acoustic effort " Poquita Ropa . He compared ( as did Arjona and other critics ) the production values and musical style of [MASK]ndependiente with past albums Animal Nocturno and Historias . Finally , he stated that " Returning fans will revel in this combination of freedom and growth , and app[MASK]eciate the return of producer Tommy Torres , the man who has been behind the boards for quit[MASK] a few of Arjona 's most popular releases " ( referring to Torres ' absence from the production of Poquita Ropa ) . 
 A contributor to the [MASK]olo[MASK]bian websit[MASK] CMI comm[MASK]nted that " listening to Independiente is a[MASK]labyrinth to go through , each song is a huge pa[MASK]h that seems to have no end , because it in[MASK]olves imagination , it invites you to dream , to charm , to bewitch . But neither leaves behind the problematic requireme[MASK]ts of love[MASK], its [MASK]oopholes , hideouts and conce[MASK]ns , as well as its bad time[MASK] in this joke that 's life " . Independiente was nominated at the P[MASK]em[MASK]os J[MASK]ventud of 2012[MASK]for the " Lo Toco Todo[MASK]( I Play It All ) " award . On 25 September 2012 , the album received two nominations at the 13th Annual Latin Grammy Awards : A[MASK]bum [MASK]f the Year and Bes[MASK] Singer @-@ songwriter album . On 3 December 2012 ,[MASK]Indep[MASK]ndiente received a nomination for " Pop Album of the Year " at the 2013 Pre[MASK]ios Lo N[MASK]estro awards . It also received a nomination for Grammy Award for Best Lat[MASK]n Pop A[MASK]bum at the Grammy Awards of 2[MASK]13 . Arjona does not win the latter award since 2[MASK]05 with Adentro in a shared win with Mexican singer Julieta Ve[MASK]egas . In February 201[MASK] , Ind[MASK]pendiente received a nomination for " Latin Pop Album of the Year " at the Billboard Latin Music Awards of 2013 .

 = 2003 Pacific typhoon season = 
[MASK]
 The 2003 Pacific typhoon season was a slightly below a[MASK]erage yearl[MASK]ng period of tropical cyclogenesis exhibiting the development of 31 tropical depressions , of which 21 became named storms ; of those , 1[MASK] became typhoons . Though every [MASK]onth w[MASK]th the exception [MASK]f February and March featured tropical activity [MASK] most storms [MASK]eveloped from May through October . During the season , tropical cyclones affected the Philippines , Ja[MASK]an , China , the Korean Peninsula , Indochina , and various islands in the western Pacifi[MASK] [MASK] 
 The season ran year [MASK]-@ round , with the first storm [MASK] Yanyan , developing west of the Ma[MASK]shall Islands on January 15 . In Ap[MASK]il , Typhoon Kujira bec[MASK]me o[MASK]e of the longest @-@ las[MASK]ing Pacific typhoons [MASK]n history and attained[MASK]climatological records for its unusually early impacts . Typhoon Imbudo in July caused several [MASK]eaths and extensive damage across the Philippines and China . In September , Typhoon Maemi became one of the co[MASK]tliest typhoons in recorded history after striking South Korea ; Mae[MASK]i was also the most[MASK]intense tropical cyclone of the season with a minimum barometric pressure of 910 mbar ( hPa ; 26 @.@ 87 in[MASK]g ) . In late November , Typhoon Lupit devastated areas of Yap State in the Federated States of Micronesia . The season closed with the dissipation of a tropical depression east of the Phili[MASK]pines on December 27 . 
 The scope of this article i[MASK] limited[MASK]to the[MASK]Pacific Ocean , north of the equator and west of the In[MASK]e[MASK]national Date Line . Storms tha[MASK] form east of the date line and north of the equator are called hurricanes ; see 2003 Pacific hurricane season . Tropical Storms for[MASK]ed in the entire west Pacific basin are assigned a name by the Tokyo Typhoon Center . Tropical depressions in this basin monitore[MASK] by the Joint Typhoon Warning Center ( JTWC ) have the " W " suffix added to their nu[MASK]ber . Tr[MASK]pical depressions that enter o[MASK] form in the Philippine area of responsibility are assigned a name by the Philippine Atmospheric , Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration or PAGASA . This can often result in the same storm having two names . 
 
 = = Seasonal forecasts = [MASK] 
 
 On March[MASK]5 , 2003 , meteorologists from the University Co[MASK]lege Lond[MASK][MASK][MASK]at the Tropical S[MASK]orm Risk ( TSR ) Consortium issued an extended range fo[MASK]ecast for the typhoon [MASK]eason , noting the likelihood of near ave[MASK]age tropical cyclone activity as a[MASK]result of projected neutral sea surface temperatures . The forecast indicated the po[MASK]ential for 26 @.@ 2 tropical storms , c[MASK]mpared to the 10 – and 30 @-@ year [MASK]verage of 27 @.@ 8 and 26 @.@ 3 storm[MASK] , respectivel[MASK] . The following month , the group rais[MASK]d their fo[MASK]ecast for tropical storms to 26[MASK]@.@ 7 , indicating a slightly above average season . Over next two months , however , fluctuations in sea surface temperatures , particularly those in the Central Pacific , caused the group to revise their predictions down[MASK]ard and indicated the proba[MASK]ility for a slightly below average typhoon season in their June forecast . A rise in sea surface temperatures in the [MASK]ollowing month[MASK] prompted [MASK]he forecasting group to once again raise their f[MASK]recasts to indicate a near @-@ average season in their final August forecast update , which predicted 27 tropical storms . The group wa[MASK] very accurate in their forecasts ,[MASK]with their Ap[MASK]il and August forecasts being the most accurate . 
 Similarly , meteorologists working with the City University of [MASK]ong Kong issued a seasonal projection on April 2[MASK] , 2003 , i[MASK]dicating the [MASK]ikelihood of a normal or below normal season with 29 total tropical cyclones , 26 tropical storms , and 16 typhoons . As with the TSR , the group primarily based their forecast numbers on the prevailing status of the El Niño @-@ Southern Oscillation . The City University of Hong Kong revised their forecasts on June 24 , 2003 , indicating a slight increase of total tropical cyclones to 30 . The group was also accurate[MASK]in their forecasts for the entirety of the Northwest Pacific , though [MASK]heir specialized forecasts for the Sout[MASK] China Sea were substantial[MASK]y off . 
 During the year , the Japan Met[MASK]orological Agency ( JMA ) issued advisories on tropical cyclones west of the International Date Line to the Malay Peninsula , and north of the equator ; this was due to the agency 's s[MASK]atus as the official Regional Specialized Meteorological Center , as designated by the World Meteorological Organization in [MASK]989 . The JMA issued fo[MASK][MASK]casts[MASK]and analyses four times a day , beginning at 0000 UTC and continuing every six hours .[MASK]The JM[MASK] issued forecasts based on a cli[MASK]atological tropica[MASK] cyclone foreca[MASK]t model . The agency estimated 10 minute sus[MASK]ained winds and barometric pressure based on the Dvor[MASK]k[MASK]technique and numerica[MASK] weather prediction . The JTWC also issued warnings on storms within the basin , operating from Pearl Harbor in Hawaii to represent the interests of the United States Armed Forces [MASK]n the [MASK]ndian and Pacific Oceans . 
 
 = = Season summary = = 
 
 Throughout the season , sea surface temperatures within th[MASK] western equ[MASK]tori[MASK]l Pacific were a[MASK]ove normal , inclu[MASK]ing those in the South China[MASK]Sea . Areas of convection persisted year @-@ round in the lower latitudes , particularly around the Philippines . Atmospheric divergence was also prevalent in the same [MASK]egions , resul[MASK]ing in enhanced tropical cyclogenesis east of the Philippines in 2003 ; the mean region of development of tropical systems during the y[MASK]ar was more southwest than the 1971 [MASK] 2000 30 @-@ year average . In 2003 , [MASK]he JMA monitored 21 tropical cyclones of at[MASK]least tropical storm[MASK]intensity[MASK]; of those , 14 reached typhoon intensity . Though the n[MASK]mber of tropical storms was below average [MASK] the ratio between tropical storms and typhoons [MASK]as 66 % greater than normal . The Philippine Atmospheri[MASK] , Geophysical and Astronomical Servi[MASK]es Adm[MASK]nistration ( PAGASA ) monitored three additional cyclones of at least tropical storm intensity that were not monitored by the JMA . 
 The season began with the formation of Tropical Storm Yanyan on January 15 . After its dissipation five da[MASK]s later , no trop[MASK]cal cyclones of at least tropical storm intensity[MASK]developed over the next two[MASK]months[MASK]. This period[MASK]of inactivity ended with the formation of Typhoon Kujira in mid @-@ April ; Kujira was[MASK]one of the longest[MASK]lived Pacific storms on record and was the first typhoon[MASK]with 1 @-@ minute sustained winds of at least 240 km / h ( 150 mph ) in April since Typhoon Isa in 1997 . Tropic[MASK]l activity was enha[MASK]ced from May to June , and during this period the JMA[MASK]monitored four tro[MASK]ical storms , while the PAGASA mo[MASK]itored a fifth storm off[MASK]the eastern Philippines . Three of the four tropical storms monitored by the JMA approached or hit Japan , inclu[MASK]ing[MASK]Typhoon Soudelor , which brought heavy rainfall and wind across the Ryukyu I[MASK]lands and the Korean Peninsula . 
 Tropical activity once again declined towards the second half of June and first half of July . The seco[MASK]d half of July , how[MASK]ver , featured the development of typhoons Imbudo and Koni , which both tracked westward across t[MASK]e Philippines before [MASK]triking [MASK]reas near Saipan a[MASK]d other regions[MASK]of southeastern China . Imbudo caused the deaths of 78 people and US $ 383 million in damage .[MASK]August was a highly [MASK]ctive m[MASK]nt[MASK][MASK]for tropical cyclogenesis , with a total of six [MASK]ropical storms monitored by the JMA[MASK], JTWC , and PAGASA . This included typhoons Krovanh and Dujuan , which also struck south[MASK]astern China . Typhoon Etau earlier in the month made landfall in Japan , resultin[MASK] in 17 deaths . 
[MASK]Activity was somewhat below average in September , with only one tropical cyclone making landfall , Maemi . However[MASK], Maemi was the strongest tropical cyclone of [MASK]he season and was the costliest wi[MASK]h roughly US $ 4 @.@ 8 billion in damage , mostly in South Korea . Tropical cyclogenesis and activity continued to decline after A[MASK]gust , with October featur[MASK]ng only three tropical storms . However , two , Ketsana and Parma , reached typhoon intensity ; both stay[MASK]d away from land . November featured less storms but was climatol[MASK]gically average , with two typhoons devel[MASK]p[MASK]ng . The second typhoon , Lupit , devastated portions of Yap State , resulting in approximatel[MASK] $ 1 @.@ 7 million in damage . In December , the JTWC and PAGASA monitored a sole tropical system east of the Philippines , though the JMA did not [MASK]onitor or classi[MASK]y any tropical cyc[MASK]ones during the month . 
 
 = [MASK] Storms = = 
 
 In storm information below , wind @-@ speed advisories differ[MASK]from the Joint Typhoon Warning Center ( JTWC ) to the JMA as the JTWC uses the Uni[MASK]ed States criteria of 1 @-@ minute mean [MASK]o designate maximum sustained winds , while the JMA uses the 10 @-@ minute [MASK]ean wind criteria to designate tropical cyclone maximum sustained winds . This difference generally results i[MASK] JTWC maximum winds appea[MASK]ing higher than the maximum winds described by[MASK]the [MASK]MA for the same cyclone[MASK]. 
 
 = = = Tropical Storm Yanyan = = = 
 
 On January 11 , the JTWC began mo[MASK]itoring the disturbance that w[MASK]uld eventu[MASK]lly develop into Yanyan near the International Date Line . As the system tracked [MASK]estward , it gradually move[MASK] [MASK]nto a more favorable environment for tropical cyclogenesis . On Janua[MASK]y 14 , surface observations indicated that the low @-@ pressure area had dev[MASK]loped a closed , low @-@ level circulation center indicative of a tropical cyc[MASK]one , satel[MASK]ite im[MASK]gery remai[MASK]ed inconc[MASK]usive . Nonetheless , the JM[MASK] classifie[MASK] the pre[MASK]sure area as a tropical depression west of the Marshall Is[MASK]ands at 0600 UTC on January 15 . The JTW[MASK] would follow suit by classifying the storm as such at 1800 UTC later that day . At the time , the depression [MASK]as tracking west @-@ northwest under the influence of [MASK] subtropical ridge to t[MASK]e north . [MASK]ver the next day the system waned in convective activity before resuming its previous track and accelerating . At 0000 UTC on January 17 , the JTWC upgraded the system to tropical storm intensity , though the storm remained nameless as the JMA continued to classify it as a tropical de[MASK]ression . 
 Throug[MASK]out January[MASK]17 the tropical storm would again o[MASK]cillate in streng[MASK]h , resulting in a brief downgrade by the JTWC to tropical depression intensity . However , an increase in deep convection resulted in its reclassification as a tropica[MASK] storm at 1800 UTC that day , followed by the JMA upgrading the[MASK]system to tropical storm[MASK]intensity at 1200 UTC on January 18 . As such , the storm received the name Yanyan . At roughly the same t[MASK]me , the tropical cyc[MASK][MASK]ne began to stall east of the Mariana Islands and curve sharply nort[MASK]eastward . Whilst the JTWC indicated[MASK]that Yanyan peaked in strength la[MASK]e on January 18 with 1 @-@ minute sustained winds of 60 km / h ( 37 mph ) [MASK] the JMA cons[MASK]dered the system to have maintained the same intensity thro[MASK]ghout its stint as a tropical storm . Steered by the same near[MASK]y subtropical ridg[MASK] , Yanyan would continue to track towards the northeast into a less favorable tropical cyclone environment . The JMA downgraded Yanyan to tropical depression at 1200 UTC on January 20 before the[MASK]storm transitioned into an extratropical cycl[MASK]ne as its low @-@ level circulation center dec[MASK]upled from the p[MASK]imary mass of convection due to strong wind shear . At 0000 UTC , both the JTWC and JMA discontinued the[MASK]mon[MASK]toring of Yanyan . 
 
 = = = Typhoon Kujira ( Amang ) = = = 
 
 Kujira developed from a broad area of disturbed weather as a tropical depression on April 9 well remove[MASK] from any landmasses . Shortly after development , Kujira quickly intensified in its early stages , and was upgraded to [MASK] tropical storm just two days after cyclogenesis . Strengthening slowed afterwards , though the st[MASK]rm attained typhoon intensity on April 14 . Intensification continued and late on April 15 , Kujira reache[MASK] its p[MASK]a[MASK] intensity with [MASK]inds of 165 [MASK]m / h ( 105 mph ) and a minimum barometric pressure of 930 mbar ( hPa ; 2[MASK] @.@ 46 inHg ) . Following peak intensi[MASK]y , Kujira would begin to track northwes[MASK] and oscillate in strength , cresting an addit[MASK]onal two tim[MASK]s in intensity [MASK] On April 21 , the typhoon was downgraded to tropi[MASK]al storm intensity and began to track erratical[MASK]y for several days east of Taiwan . However , on April 24 , Kujira would resume a nort[MASK]ward track and begin to[MASK]wea[MASK]e[MASK] , and on April 24 was downgraded to tropical depr[MASK]ssi[MASK]n strength as it made landfall on Kyushu . Foll[MASK]wing landfall , Kujira transitioned into an extratropical cyclone on April 25 , which per[MASK]isted until crossin[MASK] the Internation[MASK]l Dateline towards the end of April 2003 . 
 Shortly after developing , Kujira caused two fata[MASK]ities in Pohnpei in addition to minor agricultu[MASK]al and infrastructural damage ; similar effect[MASK] wer[MASK] felt in Guam . Several da[MASK]s later , the typhoon prompted cyclone warni[MASK]gs and other prec[MASK]utionary measu[MASK]es in the Philippines after fore[MASK]asts indicated the potential for[MASK]strong winds and [MASK]ain . However , ul[MASK]imately any effects in the archi[MASK]elago associated with Kujira remained minimal . The typhoon also prompted warning products in Taiwan ,[MASK]making it the first April ty[MASK]hoon since 1978 to cause such a feat . Unlike in the Philippines , however , Kujira would bring significant rainfall [MASK]o Ta[MASK]wan . [MASK]ffects from the[MASK]typhoon were most significant in Japan , particularly in the Ryukyu Islands . Strong winds , rain , and waves caused US $ 230 @,@ 000 ( ¥ 27 @.@ 8 millio[MASK] ) in agricultur[MASK]l damage on Ishi[MASK]aki Island . One person was killed d[MASK]e to injuries resulting from the waves . In Kyushu , heavy rainfall , peaking at 196 mm ( 7 @.@ 7 in ) in Ōita Prefecture , was reported . Overall , despite its distance away from land an[MASK] weak intensity at the time of its sole landfall , Kujira resulted in three fatalities . 
 
 = = = Typhoon Chan @[MASK]@ hom = = = 
 
 Midday on May [MASK]8 , the JTWC began t[MASK] monitor [MASK]n area of persistent disturbed[MASK]weather associated with a broad low @-@ pressure area southwest of Chuuk . Within highly conductive conditions , the di[MASK]turbance quickly organized and became classified as a tropical depression at 0000 UTC the following day . In its initial stages , the depression [MASK]racked slowly northeastwards . However , a shortwave trough forced a weakness in a nearb[MASK] ridge , allowing for the storm to take a more streamlined , n[MASK]rthward[MASK]path . At 1200 UTC on May 20 , the JMA upgraded the depression to Tropical Storm Chan @-@ hom . Following the system 's naming , Chan @-@ hom temporarily meandered towards the northwest before resuming its northeasterly track . The next day , the storm began to deve[MASK]op an eye[MASK]; this was reflected with an upgrade by the JMA to typhoon status at 0600 UTC on May 23 . Gradual inte[MASK]sification followed , and at 1800 UTC that day Chan @-@ hom reached its peak intensity with max[MASK]mum sustained winds of 155 km / h ( 10[MASK] mph ) and a minimum pressure of 9[MASK]0 mbar ( hPa ; 27 @.@ 76 inHg ) . 
 Following peak intensity , Chan @-@ hom began to intake dry ai[MASK] beginning on May 25 . At roughly the same time , the typhoon began to weaken and accelerate towards the northeast . Conditions continued [MASK]o worsen as the storm moved further north , and as t[MASK]e cyclone passed east of Minamitorishima , it was downgraded to tropical storm classification . By this time , C[MASK]an @-@ hom had lost much of its convection d[MASK]e to wind shear . Early on[MASK]May 27 , Chan @-@ hom had fully transition[MASK]d into an ex[MASK]ratropical cyclone , and these re[MASK]na[MASK]ts continued to track towards the northeast[MASK]. These extr[MASK]tropical remnants dissipated south of t[MASK]e Aleutian Islan[MASK]s the following day . Early in the typhoon 's existence , Chan @-@ hom posed a potential threat to Guam , but remained well east of the island . How[MASK]ver , after pass[MASK]ng to the northeast , winds from the typhoon fan[MASK]e[MASK] volcanic ash from the recently erupting Anatahan volcano towards the island , prompti[MASK]g precautionary m[MASK]asures in Guam . Ashfalls wer[MASK] reported on the island , forcing the cancellatio[MASK] [MASK]f seve[MASK]al flights . As a tropical storm , Chan @-[MASK] hom caused some damage to homes [MASK]nd crops on Chuuk , mostly due to heavy rains brought forth by the storm . Offshore , a 1 @,@ 04[MASK] ton fishing vessel , the Nien Feioch , sank during the storm [MASK] The ship was valued at $ 16 million . 
 
 =[MASK]= = Severe Tropical Storm Linfa ( Chedeng ) = = = 
 
 Tropical Storm Linfa developed as a tropical depression just off the western coast of Luzon on May 25 . The disturbance quickly intensified to reach tropical storm intensity a few hours after cyclogenesis . However , intensification leveled off as Lin[MASK]a exe[MASK]ute[MASK] a small clockwise loop before a subsequent landfall on Luzon on May 27 . Due to l[MASK]nd interaction the storm temporarily weakened and decoupled be[MASK]ore reforming in the [MASK]hilippine Sea . Afterwards Linfa began reintensify[MASK]ng a[MASK]d reached its peak intensity on May 29 with maximum s[MASK]stained winds [MASK][MASK] 100 km / h ( 65 mph ) and a barometric pressure of 980 mbar ( hPa ; 28 @.@ 94 inHg ) . Followi[MASK]g its pea[MASK] the tropical storm began to det[MASK]riorate and transitioned into an extratropical cyclone on May 30 ; these extratropical remnants continued to track northward through Japan befo[MASK]e diss[MASK]pating in the Sea of Okhotsk on June 4 . 
 The erratic and slow movement of Linfa off the western Philippines was the catalyst for extreme rainfall and flooding , killing 41 persons in the archipelago . Precipitation peaked at 723 mm ( 28 @.@ 5 in ) near Dagupan . Rising floodwaters[MASK]resulted in the temporary shutdo[MASK]n of government offices and numerous mudslides . In addition , strong winds caused widespread [MASK]ower outages . Overall damage from Linfa in the Philippine[MASK] amounted to ₱[MASK]192 @.@ 3 million ( US $ 3 @.@ 65 million ) . The floods also displaced 8 @,@ 367 p[MASK]ople in 1 @,@ 686 families and destroyed 178 homes . Linfa and its extratropical rem[MASK]ants later brought torrential rainfall and widespread flooding to Japan , particularly in southwestern regions . Rainfall there peaked [MASK]t 727 mm ( 28 @.@ 62 in )[MASK]. Flood damage was worst in Kōchi and Tokushima Prefectures , where several buildings were dest[MASK]oyed by floodwater . Other locations in Jap[MASK]n expe[MASK]ie[MASK]ced considerable agricultural damage as well as numerous landslides .[MASK]Overall , Linfa caused rough[MASK]y $ 28[MASK]@.@ 2 million in damage , much of wh[MASK]ch occurred in Japan [MASK] though the entirety of deaths associated with the cyclone took place in the Philippines . 
 
 = = = Severe Tropical Storm Nang[MASK]a ( Dodong[MASK]) = = = 
 
 In late May , an area of d[MASK]stur[MASK]ed weather be[MASK]an to persist in the South China Sea . The JTWC began to monitor the storm cluster on May 29 . The following d[MASK]y , the JMA reclassified the system as a tropical depression ; initially the system remained highly disorganized due to the lack o[MASK] deep convection . Persistent moderate wind shear and dry air [MASK]revented [MASK]he cyclone from strengthening sig[MASK]i[MASK]icantly in the storm 's early stages . These conditions abated as the dep[MASK]ession tracked northeast , an[MASK] at 0[MASK]00 UTC on June 1 , the JMA [MASK]pgrade[MASK] the system to Tropical Storm Nangka . Throughout the course of [MASK]he day , Nangka continued to strengthen as it accelerated northeast , and peaked in strength with a barometric pressure of 985 mbar ( hPa ; 29 @.[MASK] 09 inHg ) and maxim[MASK]m sustained winds of 95 km / h [MASK] 6[MASK] mph ) , making it a severe tropical storm . 
 However , upon moving through the Bashi Channel , conditions began to deteriorate due to increased wind shear , weakening the system and resultin[MASK] in its downgra[MASK]e to tr[MASK]pical depression status by the JMA at 1200 UTC on June 3 . Nangka continued to becom[MASK] increasingly disorganized as it moved further north , and late that day , the depression[MASK]transitioned to an extratropical cyclone . The resulting remnants continued to track well east of Japan before dissipating on June 7 . Due to its track away from landmasses , damage remained minimal ; however , as Nangka passed to the south and east of Japan , the storm brought light rainfall to the country [MASK] peaking [MASK]t 81 mm ( 3 @.@ 2 in ) in Minamidaitō , Okinawa .

 On July 15 , [MASK]he JMA estima[MASK]ed that a tropical depression formed , and the next day the JTWC initiated advisories on Tropical Depression 09W about 6[MASK]5 km ( 415 mi ) east of Yap . A subtropical ridge near Okinawa steered the nascent [MASK]epression to the west @-@ northwest for much of its duration [MASK] With warm waters and favorable upper @-@ level conditions , the depression quickly organized[MASK], first to Tropical Storm Imbudo on July [MASK]7 , and to typhoon status[MASK]two days later , when PAG[MASK]SA begin issuing advisories on Typhoon Harurot . At 0300 UTC on[MASK]July 22 , Imbudo struck northern Luzon , wit[MASK] [MASK] minute winds estimat[MASK]d at 205 km / h ( 125 mph ) by the [MASK]TWC . It weakened over land , but re @-@ intensified in the South [MASK]hina Sea , striking southern China near Yangjiang , Guangdong on July 24 . Imbudo rapidly weakened , dissipating on July 25 . 
 I[MASK] the Philippines[MASK], officials evacuated over 1[MASK] @,@ 000 people . In southern China in Yangji[MASK]ng , more[MASK]than 30 @,@ 000 people evacuated a[MASK]ead of the storm , and more than half of the trees in the city fell due to [MASK]trong winds . High winds killed a man in Hong Kong after knocking him off a pl[MASK]tform . Throughout Gu[MASK]ngdong , Imbudo destroyed 595 [MASK],@ 0[MASK]0 houses an[MASK] caused eight deaths .  = = = Tropical Storm [MASK]orakot ( Juaning ) = = = 
 
 Morakot spawn[MASK]d from an area of disturbed weather in the Philippine [MASK]ea on July 31 .  In Taiwan , where Morako[MASK] first made landfall , heavy rainfall res[MASK]lted in flooding[MASK].  = = = Typhoon Krovanh ( [MASK]iña ) = = = 
 
 Krovanh originated from[MASK]a tropical disturbance within the monsoon tro[MASK]gh east of Chuuk State on A[MASK]gust[MASK]13 . Despite rather favorable conditions , the initial tropical depression did not intensify significantly and degenerated into a remnant low on August 18 . However , these remnants were able to[MASK]reorganize and the system was reclassified as [MASK] t[MASK]opical cyclone a day later[MASK]. Intensifi[MASK]atio[MASK] was rather rapid upon the storm 's reformation – the depression reached tropical storm status on August 20 and then typhoon intensity two days later . Shortly after , Krovanh made landfall on Luzon at peak intensity with winds of 120 km / h ( 75 mph ) . The typhoon eme[MASK]ged into the South China Sea as a much weaker tropical storm , though it was able to restrengthen over warm waters . Onc[MASK] again at typhoon intensity ,[MASK]Krovanh clipped Hainan before moving over the Leizhou Peninsula on its way to a final landfall ne[MASK]r Cẩm Phả , Vietnam on August 25 . Quick[MASK]weakening due to land interaction occurred[MASK]as Krovanh [MASK]oved[MASK]across northern Vietnam , where the storm met its demise the follo[MASK]ing day . 
 Krovanh first struck the Philippines , resulting[MASK]in heavy ra[MASK]nfall and displacing approximately 1 @,@ 000 families . The flooding caused severe damage and killed one person . [MASK]ro[MASK]anh 's effects were much[MASK]more severe in China . In Hong Kong , eleven people were injured and isolated flooding occurred as a result of the typhoon 's outer rainbands . However , Guangdon[MASK] Province , Hainan Province , and Guangxi were the Chinese regions most exten[MASK]ively impacted . T[MASK]e typhoon brought record wind gusts into[MASK]Guangxi . In those three regions combined , 13 @,@ 000 homes were estimated to have [MASK]ollapsed and a large swath of farmland was damaged . Two [MASK]eople were killed in China and economic losses approxim[MASK]ted to ¥ 2 @.@ 1 billion ( US $ 253 million ) . Due to its positioning and track , of all areas in Vietnam on[MASK]y the country 's more northern [MASK]egions were impacted by Krovanh . Flash flooding occurred in earnest in those regions , and 1 @,@ 000 homes were flattened . One person was killed and five others were injured in Viet[MASK]am . Overall , the typhoon was responsible for the deaths of four persons . 
 
 = = = Tropical Storm Vamco ( Manang ) = = = 
 
 The monsoon trough spawned several tropical disturba[MASK]ces in the middle of August , one of which became Tropical De[MASK]ression Lakay near the Philippines . On August 18 [MASK] an area of convect[MASK]on persisted [MASK]n the souther[MASK] side of a circulation , developing into a tropical depression east of Luzon . It moved quickly northward and later[MASK]to the northwest in an area g[MASK]nerally unfavorable for strengthening , such as the presence of wind shear and land interaction [MASK] On August 19 , the JMA upgraded the depression to Tropical Storm Vamco to th[MASK] east of Ta[MASK]wan . Later that day , the circulation p[MASK]ssed just 55 km ( 35 mi ) north of Taipei , although the convection was exposed that time . On August 20 , the JMA assessed Vamco as dissipating in the Taiwan Strait , although the JTWC continued advisories until the storm moved ashore in southeastern China . [MASK] Rainfal[MASK] in Taiwan reached 69 mm ( 2 @.@ 7 in ) in Ilan County . On the island , the storm left several hundred houses withou[MASK] power due to a lightning strike . On mainland China , rainfall peaked at 101 mm ( 4 @.@ 0 in ) in Wenzhou , Zhejiang , which were largely beneficial in easing drought conditions , while winds gusted to 100 km / h ( 62 mph ) . The storm damaged or destroyed 5 @[MASK]@ 880 houses and flooded 1 @,@ 287 ha ( 3 @,@ 180 acres ) of paddy fields , causing ¥ 38 @.@ 6 million ( CNY , $ 4 @.@ 7 million USD ) in damage .

 = = = Typhoon Maemi [MASK] Pogi ) = = = 
 
 Typhoon Maemi formed on September 4 from the monsoon trough in [MASK]he western Pacific Ocean . [MASK]t slowly intensified into a tropical storm[MASK]while moving northwestward , and Maemi beca[MASK]e a typhoon on September 8 . That day , it quickly intensified due to favorable conditions , developing a well @-@ defined eye and reaching[MASK]peak maximum sustained winds of 195 km / h ( 120 mph ) . While near pea[MASK] intensity , Maemi was decelerating and began turning to the north @-@ northeast . The [MASK]yewall soon after passed over th[MASK] Japanese island of Miyako @[MASK]@ jima on September 10 , producing the fourth lowest p[MASK]essure on record in Japan after a pressure of 912 mbar ( 26 [MASK].@ 9 inHg ) was recorded . With warm waters , Maemi was able to[MASK]maintain much of its intensity before it made landfall just west of Busan , South Korea on September 12 . On Jeju Island , Maem[MASK] produced a[MASK]peak wind gust of 216 km / h ( 134 mph ) and a minimum pressure [MASK]f 950 mbar ( 28 inHg ) , both setting records for the country , and making it the[MASK]most powerful typhoon[MASK]to strike South Kor[MASK]a since record @-@ keeping began in the country in 1904 . The typhoon became extratropical in the Sea of Japan the next day , although the remnants persisted for several more [MASK]ays , bringing strong winds to northern Japan . 
 The typhoon first affected the Ryukyu Islands of Japan . On Miyako @-@ jima , strong[MASK]wind[MASK] damaged 104 buildings , and 95 % of residents lost power . Maemi dropped heavy rainfall[MASK]t[MASK][MASK]re , including rates of 58 @.@ 5 mm ( 2 @.@ 30 in ) in an hour , and 402 @.@ 5 mm ( 15 @.@ 85 in ) in 24 hours , the latter setting a record . One person died on Miyako @-@ jima after being struck by flying glass . E[MASK]se[MASK]here in Japan , th[MASK] storm caused[MASK]flights to be canceled , while rainfall @-@ induced landslides blocked roads . There [MASK]ere two other deaths in Jap[MASK]n , and damage totaled ¥ 11[MASK]@.@ 3 billion ( JPY , $ 96 million USD ) . Damage was heaviest in South Korea , notably where it moved ashore . Winds in Busan near the landfall location reached 154 km /[MASK]h ( 96 [MASK]ph ) , the second @-@ highest on r[MASK]cord . There , the port sustained h[MASK]av[MASK] damage , causing disruptions to exports in the months following the storm . Nationwide , the high winds destroyed about 5 @,@ 000 [MASK]ouses and damag[MASK]d 13 @,@ [MASK]00 homes and bu[MASK]inesses , leaving [MASK]5 @,@ 000 people homeless . About 1 @.@ 47 million lost[MASK]power , and widespread crop damage occurred , resulting in the worst rice crop[MASK]in 23 y[MASK]ars . Across South Korea , Maemi killed 117 peo[MASK]le , and overal[MASK] damage totaled ₩ [MASK] @.@ 52 trillion won ( $ 4 @[MASK]@ 8 billi[MASK]n USD ) . 
 
 = = = Typhoon Choi @-@ wan ( Roskas [MASK] = = = 
 
 In the middle of September , the monsoon tro[MASK]gh spawned a rapidly organizing disturbance east @-@ northeast of Luzon , with weak wind shear and favorable conditions . On Septemb[MASK]r 16 , the JMA classified it as a tropical depression , and the JTWC initiated advisories the next day . The system moved to the northwest due to the [MASK]ubtropical ridge to the northeast and later to the north[MASK]. On September 18 , the JMA upgraded the depression to Tropical Storm Choi @-@ wan , the same day that PAGASA classified it as Tropical Storm Roskas . An e[MASK]stward @-@ moving trough turned the storm to[MASK]the northeast , bringing the track over Okinawa and Amami Ōshima on September 19 . Choi @-@ wan continued gr[MASK]dually intensifying , becoming a[MASK]typhoon on September 20 to the southeast of Japan . That day , the JMA estimated peak winds of 130 km / h ( 80 m[MASK]h ) , and the JTWC estimat[MASK]d peak 1 minute winds of 185 km / h ( 115 mph ) on September 21 , after Choi @-@ wan developed a well @-@ defined eye . The typhoon weakened due to increasing wind s[MASK]ear , deteriorating to severe tropical storm status on September 22 before JMA declared it extratropical on September [MASK]3 . The remnants of Choi @-@ wan continued to the northeast , exited the basin on September 24 , and e[MASK]entually struck[MASK]southern Alaska on September 25 . 
 Wi[MASK]d gusts in Okinawa reache[MASK] 115 km / h ( 72 mph[MASK]) , while on the volcanic island of Hachijō @-@ jima , gusts reache[MASK] 214 km / h ( [MASK]33 mph ) . Choi @-@ wan dropped heavy r[MASK]infall while near Japan , peaking at 316 mm ( 12 @.@ 4 in ) on Miyake @-@ jima . In Okinawa , Choi @-@ wan flooded a boat , forcing[MASK][MASK]ts occupants to be rescued by the Coast Guard . Also on the island , heavy rainfall caused landslides and flooded houses . In Amam[MASK] Ōshima , the storm left 10 @,@ 810 pe[MASK]ple [MASK]ithout power . On Hachijō [MASK] wind gusts of 214 km / h[MASK]( 133 mph ) damaged about 200 houses . Nationwide , Choi @-@ wan destroyed 191 homes , injured 9 people , and left about ¥ 300 mi[MASK]lion ( JPY , $ 2 @.@ 5 million USD ) .

 [MASK] = = Typhoon Ketsana ( Tisoy ) = = = 
 
 In the middle of October , an area of convection persisted along the monsoon trough between Lu[MASK]on and Guam ,[MASK]developing into a tropical depression on October 17 . The same monsoon trough later spawned Typhoon Parma to the east . For several days , the system remained di[MASK]organized while dr[MASK]ftin[MASK] to the west @-@ northwest due to weak steering currents south of the[MASK]subtropical ridge . On October 19 , the JMA upgraded the depression to Tropical Storm Ketsana , a[MASK]d by that time the s[MASK]orm had begun drifting to the northeast . With favorable outflow , Ketsana quickly intensifie[MASK] into a typhoon on October 20 after developing an eye[MASK], and two days later , the JMA estimated peak winds of 165 km / h ( 105 mph ) .[MASK]The JTWC estimated peak 1 minute winds of 230 km / h ( 145 mph ) around the time the well @-@ defined eye had expanded to 37 km ( 23 mi ) . Subsequently , the typhoon accelerated northeastward into the westerlies and b[MASK]gan weakening due to inc[MASK]easing wind shear and dry air . On October 26 , Ketsana became extratropical t[MASK] the ea[MASK]t of Japan and dissipated the next day . The p[MASK]ssage of the typhoon caused surface[MASK]chl[MASK]rophyll a concentration in the ocean to increase 30 @-@ f[MASK]ld .

 The same monsoon trough that spawned Ty[MASK]hoon Koppu also pro[MASK]uced an area of convection[MASK]to the north @-@ northe[MASK]st of Guam , becoming a [MASK]ropical depression [MASK]n October 19 .  Increasing wind shear [MASK]eakened the convection , and Pa[MASK]ma d[MASK]teriorated [MASK][MASK]to a severe tropical storm on October 26 .  = = = Typhoon Nepartak ( Weng ) = = = 
 
 A tropical depression developed near Yap on November 11 . The system intens[MASK]fied gradually as it tracked quickly westwa[MASK]d toward the Phi[MASK]ippines . An a[MASK]ticyclone aloft allowed for[MASK]strengthening , and the[MASK]JMA upgraded the depression to Tropical Storm Nepartak on November 12 . Simultaneously , the cyclone entered the area of responsibility of the Philippine Atmospheric[MASK], Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration , which named it Tropical Storm Weng . At [MASK]round 1600 UTC on November 13 , Nepartak made landfall on northern Samar Island in [MASK]he Phil[MASK]ppines before traversing the remainder of the archipelago from east to west . The cyclone emerged into the South China Sea weakened but quickly re @-@ i[MASK]t[MASK]nsified while continuing to the west @-@ north[MASK]est . The JTWC estimated[MASK]peak winds of 140 [MASK]m / h ( 85 mph ) on November 16 , and later that day , the JMA up[MASK]raded the storm to typhoon status , estimating peak 10 @-@ minute winds of 120 km / h ( 75 mph ) .[MASK]On Novem[MASK]er 18 , Nepartak passed near southwestern Hainan and weakened , with the convection diminishing from the circulation . By the next day , the system weakened to tropical depression status , a[MASK]d dissipated short[MASK]y after moving ashore over Bei[MASK]ai , China . 
 In the Philippines , [MASK]epartak produced strong winds , heavy rainfall , and rough seas . The storm caused wide[MASK]pread power outages and ferry[MASK]disruptions . Acc[MASK]rding to the PAGASA in its post @-@ storm report , [MASK] total of 13 people lost their lives [MASK]uring the storm . O[MASK] Hainan , the storm helped end[MASK]one of the worst summer droughts in almost 65 years , although it also left heavy crop damage , wrecking 64 @,@ [MASK]00 ha ( 160 @,@ 000 acres ) of fields and killing 400 head of livestock . With about 800 homes destroyed , damage on[MASK]Hainan amounted to $ 197 million ( 2003 USD [MASK] . Effects were[MASK]minor in mainland China . 
 
 = = = Typhoon Lupit ( Yoyoy ) = = = 
 
 Typhoon L[MASK]pit formed on Novem[MASK]er 18 [MASK]rom the monsoon trough to the west of the Marshall Islands . Early in its duration , it moved generally to th[MASK] west or west @-@ southwest . On November 21 , the depression intensified into Tropical Storm Lupit , and two days later , it strengthened into a typhoon , de[MASK]eloping an eye . Lupit later began a[MASK]prolonged movement to the northwest , during[MASK]which it passed[MASK]near several[MASK]islands in Yap State . The typhoon re[MASK]ched peak intensity on November 26 [MASK] with peak 10 – min[MASK]te sustained winds of 18[MASK] km / h ( 115 mph ) . It later weakened due to a variety of unfavorable conditions , and after recurving to the northeast , Lupit became extratropical south of Jap[MASK]n on December 2 . 
 [MASK]yphoon Lupit first affected Pohn[MASK]ei with gusty [MASK]inds , and late[MASK] it dam[MASK]ged or destroyed about 200 [MASK]omes in Chuuk [MASK]tate . There , high waves flooded roads and homes , while high wi[MASK]ds damaged crops . Damage was heaviest in Yap State , mostly in th[MASK] small Ulithi atoll and Fais Island . On both islands , the t[MASK]phoon contaminated the water supply and wrecke[MASK] the crops . Rainfall[MASK]reached 263 mm ( 10 @.@ 35 in ) on Ulithi , and gusts reached 158 km / h ( 98 mph ) . Throughout the FSM , damage totaled about $ 1 @.@ 7 million , although there were no deaths . The damage prompted the FSM government to declare two states as disaster areas , as well as[MASK]a disaster declaration from the United States federal government . While Lupit was becoming extratrop[MASK]cal , it became the first typhoon in December to threaten Ja[MASK]an in 13 year[MASK] . The[MASK]storm dropped rainfall that resulted in mudslid[MASK]s[MASK]and [MASK]light cancellations .

 = = Storm names = = 
 
 Within the North @-@ western Pacific Ocean ,[MASK]both the Japan Meteoro[MASK]ogical Agency ( JMA ) and the Philippine Atmospheric , Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration assign names to tropical[MASK]cycl[MASK]nes that develop in the West[MASK]rn Pacific , which can result in a tropical cyclone h[MASK]vin[MASK] two names[MASK]. The Japan Meteorol[MASK]gical Agency 's RSMC Tokyo — Typhoon Center assigns international names to tropical cyclones on behalf of the World Meteorological Organization 's Typhoon Committee ,[MASK]should they be judged to have 10 @-@ minute sustained windspeeds of 65 k[MASK] / h , ( 40 mph ) . While the Philippine Atmospheric , Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration a[MASK]signs names to tropical cyclones which move into or form as a tropical depression in their[MASK]area of responsibility located between 135 ° E and 115[MASK]° E and between 5 ° N @-@ 25 ° N even if the cyclone has had an intern[MASK]tional name assigned to it[MASK]. The names of significant tropical cyclone[MASK] are retired , by both PAGASA and[MASK]the Typhoon Committee [MASK] Should the list of names for the Philippine region be exhausted then names will be taken from an auxiliary list of whi[MASK]h the firs[MASK] ten are published ea[MASK]h season . Unused nam[MASK]s are marked in gray . 
 
 = = = International names = = = 
 
 During the season 21 [MASK]amed trop[MASK]cal cyclones developed in the Western Pacific and were named[MASK]by the Ja[MASK]an Meteorological Agency , wh[MASK]n it was determined that they had become tropical storms . These names were contributed to a list of a 140 names submitted by the fourteen [MASK]embers nations [MASK]nd territories of the ESCAP /[MASK]WMO Typhoon Committee . 
 
[MASK]= = = Phi[MASK]ippines = = = 
 
 The [MASK]h[MASK]lippine Atmospheric , Geophysical and [MASK]stronomical Services Administration uses its own naming scheme for tropical cyclones in their area of responsibi[MASK]ity . PAGASA assigns names to tropical depressi[MASK]ns that form within the[MASK]r area of responsibility and[MASK]any tropical cyclone that might move into their area of responsibility . Should the list of names for a given year prove to be insufficient , names are taken from an auxiliary[MASK]list , the first 10 o[MASK] [MASK]hich are published each year before the season start[MASK] . The names not retired from this li[MASK]t will be used again in the 2007 season . Names that were not assigned are marked in gray . 
 
 = = = Retirement = = = 
 
 The names Imbudo and Maemi were retired by the ESCAP / WMO Typhoon [MASK]ommittee . The names Molave and Mujigae were chosen [MASK]o[MASK]replace Imbudo and Maemi respectiv[MASK]ly . While Yanyan was requested by Hon[MASK] Kong to be removed in the list , and was replaced by Dolphin . The Philippine Atmosp[MASK]eric , Ge[MASK]physical and Astronomical [MASK]ervices Administration ( PAGASA ) announced tha[MASK] the name Harurot had its name retired due to extensive damage . The name Hanna was [MASK]hosen to replace Harurot . Also , the name " Koni " was replaced by " Goni "[MASK], after it was f[MASK]und that Koni was a misspelling .

 = Oxaziridine = 
 
 An oxaziridine is an organic molecu[MASK]e that features a three @-@ membered heterocycle containing oxygen , nitro[MASK]en ,[MASK]and carbon . In their largest [MASK]p[MASK]lication , oxazidines are intermediates in the industrial production of hydrazine . Oxaziridine deriva[MASK]ives are also used as specialized reagents in organic chemistry for a variety of o[MASK]idations , including alpha hydroxyla[MASK]ion of enolates , epoxidati[MASK][MASK] and aziridination of olefins , and other heteroatom transfer reactions . Oxaziridines also serve a[MASK] precursors to amides and participate in [ 3 + 2 ] cycloadditions with various heterocumulenes [MASK]o form substituted five @-@ membered heterocycles . Chiral oxaziridine derivatives effect asymmetric oxygen transfer to prochiral enolates as well as ot[MASK]er substrates . Some oxaziridines also [MASK]ave t[MASK]e property of a high barrier to inversion of the nitrogen , allowing for the possi[MASK]ility of chiral[MASK]ty at the nitrogen center . 
 
 = = History = = 
 
 Oxaziridine derivatives were first reported in the mid @-@ 1950s by Emmons and subsequently by Krimm and Horner and Jürgens . Whereas oxygen and nitrogen typically [MASK]ct as nucl[MASK]ophiles due to their high electronegativity , oxaz[MASK]ridines allow for electrophilic transfer of both h[MASK]teroatoms . This unusual reactivity is due to [MASK]he presence of the highly strained three membered ring and t[MASK]e relatively weak N @-@ O bond . Nucleophiles [MASK]end to attack [MASK]t the aziridine nitrogen when the nitrogen substituent is small ( R1 = H ) ,[MASK]and at the oxygen atom when the nitrogen substituent has greater steri[MASK] bulk . The unusual electronics of the oxaziridine system may be exploited to perform a n[MASK]mber of oxygen and nitrogen transfer reactions including , but not limited to : α @-@ hydroxylation of enolates , epoxidation of [MASK]lkenes , selective oxidation [MASK]f sulfides and selenides , amination of [MASK] @-@ nucleophiles and [MASK] @-@ acylamidation . 
 The Peroxide process for the industrial production o[MASK] hydrazine through[MASK]the oxidation of ammonia with hydrogen peroxide in the presence of ketones was developed in the early 1[MASK]70s . 
 Chiral camphorsulfonyloxaziridines proved useful in the s[MASK]ntheses of complex natural product , such as t[MASK]xol which is marketed[MASK]as a chemotherapy ag[MASK]nt . Both the Holton Taxol total synthesis and the Wender Taxol total[MASK]synthesis feature asymmetric α @-@ hydroxylatio[MASK] with camphorsulfonyloxaziridine . 
 
 = =[MASK]Synthesis = = 
 
 
 = = = N @-@ H , N @-@ Alkyl , N @-@ Aryloxaziridines = = = 
 
 The two main app[MASK]oaches to synt[MASK]esis of N [MASK]-[MASK] H , N @-@ alkyl , and N @-@ aryloxaziridines are oxidation of imines with peracids ( A ) and amination[MASK]of carbonyls ( B ) . 
 Additional[MASK]y , oxidation of chiral imines and oxidation of imines with chiral peracids may yield enantiopure oxaziridines . Some oxaziridines have the unique property of configurationally stable nitrogen atoms at room temperature due to an inversion barrier of 24 to 31 kcal / mol . Enantiopure oxaziridines where stereochemistry is entirely due to configurationally stable nitrogen are reported . 
 
 = = = N @-@ Sulfonyloxaziridines = = = 
 
 In the late 1970s and [MASK][MASK]rly 1980s Franklin A. Davis synthesized the first N @-@ sulfonyloxa[MASK]iridine[MASK] , which act exclusively as oxygen transfer reagen[MASK]s , and are the mos[MASK] predominantly used class of oxaziridines today . While originally s[MASK]nthesized with mCPBA and the phase transfer catalyst benzyltrimeth[MASK]lammonium chloride , an[MASK]impr[MASK]ved synthesis using oxone as the oxidant is now most prevalent . 
 Many N @-@ su[MASK]fo[MASK]yloxaziridines are used today , each wit[MASK] slightly diff[MASK]rent properties and reactivity . These reagents are summarized in the table below . 
 
 = = = Perfluori[MASK]ated oxa[MASK]iridines = = = 
 
 Wi[MASK]h highly electron withdrawing perfluoroalkyl substitu[MASK]nts , oxaziridines exhibit reactivity more similar to that of dioxiranes than typical oxaziridines . Notably , perfluoroa[MASK]kyloxaziridines hydroxy[MASK]ate certain C @-@ H bonds with high [MASK]electivity . Perfluorinated ox[MASK]ziridines may be synthesized by subjecting a perfluorinated imine to perfluoromethyl fluorocarbonyl peroxide and a metal fluoride to act as an HF [MASK]caveng[MASK]r . 
 
 = = Reactions of oxaziridines = = 
 
 
 = = = Hydrazine production = [MASK] = 
 
 Oxaziridines are intermediates in the Peroxide process for the production of hydrazine . Many mil[MASK]i[MASK]ns of[MASK]kilograms of hydrazine are produced annually by this method that involves a step wherein ammonia is oxidized in the presence of methyl ethyl ketone to give the oxaziridine : 
 Me ( Et ) C = O + NH3 + H2O2 → Me ( Et ) CONH + H2O 
 In subsequent steps the oxaziridine is converted to the hydrazone , which is the immediate en route to hydrazine : 
 [MASK]e ( Et[MASK]) CONH + NH3 → Me ( Et ) C = NNH2 + H2O 
[MASK]
 = = = Oxygen transfer = = = 
 
 
 = = = = α @-@ Hydroxylation of enolates = = = = 
 
 α @-@ Hydroxyketones , or acyloins , are an important synthetic motifs[MASK]present in many na[MASK]ural products. α @-@ Hydroxyketones have been synthesized in many ways , including reduct[MASK]on of α @-@ diketones , substitution of a hydroxyl for a[MASK][MASK]eaving g[MASK]oup and direc[MASK] oxidation of an enolate . Oxodiperoxymolybdenum ( pyridine ) - ( hexamethylphosphoric triamide ) ( MoOPH ) and N @-@ sulfonyloxaziridines are [MASK]he most common el[MASK][MASK]trophilic so[MASK]rces of oxygen implemented in this process . One advantage of using N @-@ sulfonyloxaziridines is that higher chiral induction is almost invari[MASK]bly obse[MASK]ved relative to MoOPH and other oxidants . High yield ( 77 @-@ 91 % ) and dr ( 95 : 5 - 99 : 1 ) are re[MASK]orted for[MASK]α @-@ hydroxylatio[MASK] with the Eva[MASK]s ' chiral auxiliary[MASK]with N @-@ sulfonyloxaziridine as the elec[MASK]rophile . Chiral induction has been demonstrated with[MASK]many other chiral ketones and ketones with chiral auxili[MASK]ries , including[MASK]SAMP[MASK]and RAMP[MASK]. 
 Extensive work has been r[MASK]ported on asymmetric hydroxylation of proch[MASK]ral enolates with camphorsulfonyloxazir[MASK]dine derivativ[MASK][MASK] , achieving moderate to high enantiomeric excess . The commonly accepted proposed transition state that justifies this st[MASK]reochemical outcome involves an open transition state where the steric bulk of R1 det[MASK]rmines the face of approach . 
 The selecti[MASK]ity of some hydroxylations may[MASK]be drastically improved in some cases with the addition of coordinating groups alpha to the oxaziridine ring as oxaziridines 3b and 3c in the table above . In these instances it is proposed that the reaction proceeds through a closed transition state where the metal oxyanion is stabi[MASK]ized by chelation from the sulfate and coordinating groups on the camphor skeleton . 
 α @-@ Hydroxylation with oxaziridines has been widely implemented in total synthesis . It is a key step in both the H[MASK]lton Taxol total synthesis and the Wender Taxol total synthesis . Additionally , Forsyth implemented the transformation in his [MASK]ynthesis [MASK]f the C3 @-@ C14 ( Substituted 1 @,@ 7 @-@ Diox[MASK]spiro [ 5 @.@ 5 ] undec @-@ 3 @-@ ene ) System of Okadaic acid . 
 
 = = = = Epo[MASK]idation of alkenes = = = = 
 
 Epoxidation of alkenes is a common reaction because epoxides [MASK]an be derivatized in a [MASK]umber of useful ways . Classically ,[MASK]laboratory epoxidation is carried out with m[MASK][MASK]BA or other peracids . Ox[MASK]ziridines have be[MASK]n found [MASK]o be us[MASK]ful for the formation of highly acid se[MASK]sitive epoxides . ( − ) -Chaetominine[MASK]was synthesized via oxaziridine epoxidation as a late stage transformati[MASK]n as seen below . 
 Another transformation of high synthet[MASK]c utility is asymm[MASK]tric epoxidation . A number of asymmetric epoxid[MASK]tions exist : the Sharpless epoxidation , the Jacobsen @-@ Katsuki e[MASK]oxidation , and the Juliá @-@ Colonna E[MASK]oxidation . These methods require specific functionality in order to achieve sel[MASK]ctivity . The Sharpless epoxidation is specific to allylic alcohol[MASK] , the Jacobsen[MASK]epoxidation requires [MASK]is @-@ disubstituted aryl alkenes , and th[MASK] Juliá epo[MASK]idation requi[MASK]es α @-@ β unsaturated keton[MASK]s . Chiral oxaziridines act stereospecifically on many u[MASK]functionalized alkenes . It has eve[MASK] possible to[MASK]effect stereospecific epoxidation catalytically in the oxazir[MASK]dine chiral unit . Further investigation into these react[MASK]ons may be required before levels of enantiometi[MASK] excess become practical for larg[MASK] scale synthesis .[MASK]Lusinichi et al. have investigated asymmetric epoxidation with a chiral oxaziridinium s[MASK]lt using oxone as the stoichiometric oxidant seen below . 
 
 = = = [MASK] Hydroxylation of unactivated hydrocarbons = = = = 
 
 Perfluorinated oxa[MASK]iri[MASK]ines are known to hydro[MASK]ylate unactivated hydrocarbons with remarkable regio , and diastereospecificity . This is[MASK]a highly coveted transformation , and similar reactivity [MASK]nd specificity is seldom rivaled , especially considering the nonmetallic nature of the oxida[MASK]t . Perfluorin[MASK]ted oxaziridines show high selectivity toward tertiary hydrog[MASK]ns . Hydroxylation of p[MASK]imary carbons and dihydroxylation of a compound with two oxidizable sites have never been observed . Retention of stereochemistry is very high , often 95 - 98 % . ( retenton of stereochemistry may be further enhanced by the addition of a fluoride salt ) .

[MASK]
 Oxaziridines with unsubstituted or acylated nitrogens are capable of nitrogen [MASK]tom[MASK]transf[MASK]r , although this reactivity has received considerably less attention[MASK]. 
 
 = = = = Amination of N @-@ n[MASK]cleophiles = = = = 
 
 Amination of nucleophiles with N @-@ unsubstituted oxazirid[MASK]nes is quite versatile in the breadth of po[MASK]sible nucleophile[MASK] and corresponding products . Hydrazines may be derived fr[MASK]m the aminati[MASK]n of secondary or tertiary amines , hydroxylamine and thiohydroxamines may be formed from t[MASK]eir corresponding alcohols and thiols , sulfimides may be formed from [MASK]hioethers and α @-@ aminoketones may be formed by attac[MASK] of corresponding enolates . 
 
 = = = = N @-@ acylamidation = = = = 
 
 The transfer of acylated amines is more difficult [MASK]han that of unsu[MASK]stituted a[MASK]ines , altho[MASK]gh , unlike amine transfer by oxaziridines , there are no alternat[MASK]ve methods that directly transfer acylated amines . Acylamine transfer has primarily been performed using amines and hydrazines[MASK]as nucleophiles . Very few transfers of acylated nitrogens to carbon nucleophiles [MASK]ave been [MASK]uccessfully performe[MASK] , although some do exist in the literature . 
 
 = = = Rearrangements = = = 
 
 Oxazi[MASK]idines have been[MASK]found to undergo rearrangement reactions via a radical mechanism when irradiated with UV light or in the presence of a single electron transfer reagent such as CuI. spirocylic oxaziridines[MASK]undergo ring expansions to the correspondin[MASK] lactam . Interesti[MASK]gly , the migrating substituent is determined by a stereoelectronic effect where the group trans to the lone pair on [MASK]he nitrogen will always be the pre[MASK]ominant migration product . In light of this effect , it is possible to take advantage of the chiral nitrogen[MASK]due to high inversion [MASK]arrier to direct the rearrangement . This phenomenon is demonstrated by observed sele[MASK]tivities [MASK]n the rearrangements below . In the r[MASK][MASK]rrangement on th[MASK] left the thermodynamically[MASK]unfavor[MASK]ble product is observed exclusively , while in the reaction on [MASK]he right the product derived from the less[MASK]stable radical intermediat[MASK] is favored [MASK] 
 Aubé takes advantage of this rearrangement as the key step in his synthesis of ( + ) -yohimbine , a natural medicine classified by the NIH as possibly effective in the treatment of erectile dysfunction and the sexual problems cause[MASK] by selective serotonin [MASK]euptake inhibitors . 
 It is also notable that oxazirid[MASK]nes[MASK]will thermally [MASK][MASK]arrange to nitrones . Cis @-@ tran[MASK] selectivity of the resulting nitrone is poor , however , yields are goo[MASK] to excellent . It is thought that some oxaziridines racemize over [MASK]ime thr[MASK]ugh a nitrone intermediate .

 = Battle of Dürenstein = 
 
 The Battle of Dürenstein ( al[MASK]o known as the Battle of Dürrenstein [MASK] Battle of Dürnstein and Battle of Diernstein ; German : Gefecht bei Dürrenstein ) , on[MASK]11 November 1805 was an engagement[MASK]in the Napoleonic Wars dur[MASK][MASK]g th[MASK] War of the [MASK]hird Coalition . Dürenstein ( modern Dürnstein )[MASK]is l[MASK]cated in the Wachau Valley , on the River Danube , 73 kilometers ( 45 mi ) upstream from Vienna , Austria . The river makes a crescent @-@ shaped curve between Dürnstein and nearby Krems an der Donau and [MASK]he battle was fought [MASK]n the flood plain between the river[MASK]and the mountains . 
 At Dürenstein a combined f[MASK]rce of Russian and Austrian troops trapped a French division commanded by Théodore Maxime Gazan . The Fren[MASK]h division was [MASK]art of the newly created VIII Corps , the so @-@ called Corps Mortier , under command of Édouard Mortier . In pursuing the Austrian[MASK]re[MASK]reat fr[MASK]m Bavaria , Mort[MASK]er had over @-@ extended his three divisions along the north bank of the Danube . Mikhail Illarionovich K[MASK]tuzov , commander of the Coalition force , enticed Mortier to send Gazan 's division into a trap and French troops were caught in a valley between two Rus[MASK]ian columns . They were resc[MASK]ed by the timely arrival of a second division , under command of Pierre Dupont de l 'Étang . The battle extended well into the night . Both sides claimed victory . Th[MASK] French lost more than[MASK]a third of their parti[MASK]ipants , and Gazan 's d[MASK]vision experienced over 40 pe[MASK]cent losses . The Austrians and Russians also had heavy[MASK]losses--close to 16 perc[MASK]nt--but perhaps the[MASK]most significant was the[MASK]death in action of Johann Heinrich von Schmitt , one of Austria 's most capable chiefs of staff . 
 The battl[MASK] was fought t[MASK]ree weeks after the Austrian capitulation at Ulm and three weeks before the Russo @-@ Austrian defeat at the Battle of Austerlitz . After [MASK]usterlitz Austria withdrew from the war .[MASK]The French demanded a high indemnity and Francis II abdi[MASK]ated as Holy Roman Emperor , releasing the German states from their allegiance to the [MASK]oly [MASK][MASK]man Empire . 
 
 = = Background = = 
 
 In a serie[MASK] of conflicts from 1803 @-@ 15 [MASK]nown as the Napoleonic Wars , v[MASK]rious [MASK]uropean powers formed five coalitio[MASK]s against the First French Empire . Like the wars sparked by the French Revolution ( 1789 ) [MASK] these further revolutionized the formation , organization and training of European armies and led to a[MASK] unprecedent[MASK]d militarization ,[MASK]mainly d[MASK]e to mass conscripti[MASK]n . Under the leadership of Napoleon , French power rose qu[MASK]ckly as the Grande Armée conquered most of Europe , and collapsed rap[MASK]dly after the disastrous invasion of Russia in 1812 . Napoleon 's empi[MASK]e ultimately suffered complete military defeat [MASK]n the 1813 – 14 campaigns , resulting in the restoration of the Bourbon monarchy in France . Although Napoleon made a spec[MASK]acular return in 1815 [MASK] known as the Hundred Days , his defeat at the Battle of Waterloo , the pursuit of his army and himself , his abdication and bani[MASK]hment to the Island of Saint Helena concluded the Napoleonic Wars . 
 
 = = Danube campaign = = 
 
 From 1803 @-@ 06 the Third Coalition [MASK]ought the First French Empire and its client states ( see table at right ) . Alth[MASK]ugh several nav[MASK]l b[MASK]ttles determined control of the seas , the outcome of the war was decided on the continent , pre[MASK]ominantly in two major land operations in the Danube[MASK]valley : the Ulm campaign in the upper Danube and the Vienna campaign , in the middl[MASK][MASK]Danube valley . 
 Political conflicts i[MASK] Vienna delayed Austria 's entry into the Third Coalition until[MASK]1805 [MASK] After hostilities of the War of the Second Coalition ended in 1801 , Archduke Charles--the emperor 's brother--took advantag[MASK] of the subsequent years of peace to develop a military restructuring plan . He caref[MASK]lly put this plan into eff[MASK]ct beginning in [MASK]803 – 04 , but implementation was incomplete in 1805 when Karl Mac[MASK] , Lieutenant Field Marshal and [MASK]uartermaster @-@ General of the Army , implemented his own restructu[MASK]ing . Mack bypassed Charles ' methodical approach [MASK] Occurring in the field , Mack 's plan also undermined the overall command and orga[MASK]izational str[MASK]cture . Regardless , Mack sent an[MASK]enthusiastic report to Vienna on the military 's readi[MASK]ess . Furthermore , after misreading Napoleon 's[MASK]maneuvers in Württemberg[MASK], Ma[MASK]k also report[MASK]d to Vienna on the weakness of French dispositions . His reports convince[MASK][MASK]the war party advising the emperor , Francis[MASK]II , to enter the conflict against France , despite Charles ' own advice to the contrary . Res[MASK]onding to the report and rampant anti @-@ French feve[MASK] [MASK]n Vienna [MASK] F[MASK]ancis dismissed Charles from his post as generalissimo and appointed hi[MASK] Francophobic brother @-@ in @[MASK]@ law[MASK], Archduke Ferdinand , as commander . 
 The inexperienced Ferdinand was a poor choice of repl[MASK]cement for the capable Charles , having neither[MASK][MASK]aturity nor aptitude for the a[MASK]signment . Although Ferdinand retained nominal command , day @-@ to @-@ day decisions were placed in the hands of Mack , equal[MASK]y ill @-@ suited for such[MASK]an important assignment . When Mack was wounded early in the campai[MASK]n , he was unable to take full charge of the army . Consequently , command further devolved to Lieutenant Field Marshal Karl[MASK]Philipp , Prince of Schwarzenberg , an able cavalry officer but inexperience[MASK] in the c[MASK]mmand of such a large army . 
 
 = = = Road to Ulm = = = [MASK] 
 The campaign in the upper Danube [MASK]alley began in October , with seve[MASK]al clashes in Swa[MASK]ia . Near the Bavarian town of W[MASK][MASK]tingen , 40 kilometers ( 25 mi ) nor[MASK]hwest of Augsburg , on 8 Octob[MASK]r the 1st Regiment of dragoons , part of Murat 's Reserve Cavalry Corps ,[MASK]and grenadiers [MASK]f Lannes ' V Corps surprised an Austrian force half its size . The Austrians were arrayed in a line and [MASK]nable to form their defensiv[MASK] squares quickly e[MASK]ough to protect themselves from the 4 @,@ 000 dragoons and 8 @,@ 000 grenadiers . Nearly 3 @,@ 000 Austrians were c[MASK]ptured and[MASK]over 400 were killed or wounded . A day later , at another small town , Günzburg--immediately south of the Danube River[MASK]-the French 59th Regiment of [MASK]he Line st[MASK]rmed a bridge over the Danube and , humi[MASK]iatingly ,[MASK]chased two large Austrian columns toward Ulm . 
 Th[MASK] campaign was not entirely bad news for Vienna . At Haslach , Johann von Klenau [MASK]rrange[MASK] his 25 @,@ 000 infantry and cavalry in a prime defensive position and , on 11 October , the overly confident Gener[MASK]l of Division Pierre Dupont de l 'Étang attacked Klenau 's force with fewer than 8 @,@ 000 men . The French lost 1 @,@ 500 men killed and wounded . Aside from taking the Imperial Eagles [MASK]nd guidons of[MASK]the 15th an[MASK] 17t[MASK] Dragoons , Klenau 's force also captured 900 men , 11 guns and 18 ammunition wagons . 
 Klenau 's victory was a singular success . On 14 October Mack sent two columns out of Ulm in preparation for a breakou[MASK] to the north : one under Johann Sigismund Riesch headed toward[MASK]Elchingen to secure the bridge there , and the other under Franz von Werneck went[MASK]north with most of the heavy artillery . Recognizing the opportu[MASK]ity , Marshal Michel Ney hurried the re[MASK]t of his VI Corps forward to re @-@ establish contact with Dupont , who [MASK]as still north of the Danube . In a two @-@ pronged attack Ney sent one div[MASK]sion to the south of Elch[MASK]ngen on the r[MASK]ght [MASK]ank [MASK]f the D[MASK]nube .[MASK]This division began the assault at Elchingen . At the same t[MASK]me another division crossed the river to the east and moved west against Riesch 's position . After clearing Au[MASK]trian pickets from a[MASK]bridge , the French[MASK]attacked and captured a strategically located abbey at the top of the hill at bayonet[MASK]point . The Austrian cavalry unsuccessfully tried to fend off the French , but the Austrian infantry broke and ran . In this engagement alone , the Austrians lost more than[MASK]half their reserve art[MASK]llery park , 6 @,@ 000 ( out of 8 @,@ 000 total participants ) dead , wounded or captured and four colors . Rei[MASK]ch 's column also failed to destroy the bridges[MASK]across the D[MASK]nube . 
 Napoleon 's lightning campaign exp[MASK]sed the Austrian indecisive command structur[MASK] and poor supply apparatus . Mack completely misread the French dispos[MASK]tions and scattered his forces ; as the French defeated each unit separately , the [MASK]urviving Austrians withdrew toward the Ulm fortifications . Napoleon arrived to take personal command of close to [MASK]0 [MASK],@ [MASK]00 men . At Ulm on 16 October Karl Mack surrendered his encircled army of 20 @,@ 000 infantry and 3 @,@ 273 cavalry . The o[MASK]ficers were released on the condition that they not serve against France until formally exch[MASK]nged for French officers captured by the Austrians , an agreement to which they held . 
 
 =[MASK]= Prelude to ba[MASK]tle = = 
 
 The few Austri[MASK]n corps not trappe[MASK] at Ulm withdrew toward Vienna , with the French in close pursuit . A Russian army under Gen. Mikhail Kutuzov also maneuvered away from the French , [MASK][MASK]thdraw[MASK]ng to [MASK]he east . At the Ill river on 22 October it joined with the retreating Austrian corps commanded by [MASK]ichael von Kienmayer . On 5 November the Coalition forces held a successful rearguard action in Amstetten . On 7 November the Russians arrived in St. Pölten a[MASK]d c[MASK]ossed the Danube river the next day . Late on 9 November they destroyed the bridges across the Danube , holding the last one at the hamlet of Stein , near t[MASK]e village Krems , until the late aft[MASK][MASK][MASK]oon .

 To the east of Stein , 2 kilometers ( 1 @.@ 2 mi ) d[MASK]wn an old road , lay Krems , with its small population of a few hundred , at the confluence of the stream of that name and [MASK]he Danube . [MASK]t the [MASK]ar [MASK]estern end of the floodplain , wh[MASK]re the mountains came down almost to the river 's edge , was Dürenstein with its castle , known as Schloss Düren[MASK]t[MASK]in . The ca[MASK]tle had served as a prison for Richard I of England in 1193 . It [MASK]tands at 159 meters ( 522 f[MASK] ) , on the highest ridg[MASK] of a mountain fissu[MASK]ed with clefts and pinnacles of granite . N[MASK]rrow c[MASK]nyons [MASK]ut through the mountain , and w[MASK]den into the plain below . Near the hamlets , the Loiben flood[MASK]plain was at its widest , extending [MASK]t the most 762 meters ( 2 @,@ 500 ft ) from the base of the L[MASK]ibenberg mountain to the [MASK]ank of the river . 
 Th[MASK] region was known for its wine .
