 = = = Jewi[MASK]h tradition = = = 
 
[MASK]At [MASK]he end of 66 , conflict broke out between Greeks an[MASK] Jews in Jerusalem and Caesarea .[MASK]According to the Talmud , Nero went [MASK]o Jerusalem and shot arrows in all four directions . All the arrows landed in the city . [MASK]e then asked a passing child to repeat th[MASK] verse he had learned that d[MASK]y . [MASK]he child responded , " I will lay my vengeance upon Edom by [MASK]he hand of my people Israel " ( Ez . 2[MASK] @,@ 14 ) . Nero became terrified , believing that God wanted [MASK]he Temple in Jerusalem to be destroyed , but would punish the o[MASK]e to carry it out . Nero said , " [MASK]e desires to lay waste His House and to lay the blame on me , " whereupon he fled and converted to Judaism to avoid su[MASK]h retribution . Vespasian [MASK]as then dispa[MASK]ched to put down the rebellion . 
 The Talmud adds that the sage Reb Meir Baal HaNess , R[MASK]bbi Meir or Rabbi M[MASK]ir Baal HaNes ( Rabbi Meir the miracle ma[MASK]er ) was a Jewish sage who lived in the time[MASK]of the Mishna a prominent supporter of the Bar Kokhba rebellion against Roman[MASK]rule . He was considered one [MASK]f the g[MASK]eatest of the Tannaim of the third generat[MASK]on ( 139 @-@ 163 ) . According to the Talmud , his father was[MASK]a descendant of the Roman Emperor Nero who[MASK]had converted to Judaism . His wife Bruriah is one of the few w[MASK]men cited in the Gemara . He is the t[MASK]ird most frequently mentioned sage in the Mishnah . 
 Roman and[MASK]Greek sources nowhere report Nero 's alleged t[MASK]ip to Jerusalem or his alleged conversion to Judaism . There is also no record of Nero having any offspring who survived infanc[MASK] : his only recor[MASK]ed[MASK]child , Claudia Augusta , died aged 4 months . 
 
 = = = Christian traditi[MASK]n = = = 
 
 Non @-@ Christian historian Tacitus desc[MASK]ibes Nero exte[MASK]sively torturing and executing Christians after the fire of 64 . [MASK]uetonius also m[MASK][MASK]tions Nero punishing Christians , though he does so[MASK]because they are " given to a new and mischievous super[MASK]tition " and does not connect it with the fire . 
 Christian writ[MASK]r Tertulli[MASK]n ( c . 155 – 230 ) was the first to call Nero the first persecutor of Christians . He wrote , " Examine your records . Ther[MASK] you will find that Nero was the first that persecuted this doctrine " . Lact[MASK]ntius ( c . 240 –[MASK]320 ) also said that Nero " first persecuted the servants of God " . a[MASK] does Sulpicius Severus . However , Suetonius writes that , " since the Jews constantly made disturbanc[MASK]s at the instigation of Chrestus , he [ emperor Claudius ] expelled them[MASK]from Rome " ( " Iudaeos impulsore Chresto assidue tumul[MASK]uantis Roma expulit " ) . These expelled[MASK]" Jews " may have been early Christians , although Suetonius is not explicit . Nor is the [MASK]ible explicit , calling Aquil[MASK] of Pontus and his wife , Priscilla , both e[MASK]pelled[MASK]from Italy at the time , " Jews " . 
 
 = = = = Ma[MASK]tyrdoms of Peter and Paul = = = = 
 
 T[MASK]e f[MASK][MASK]st text to su[MASK]gest that Nero ordered[MASK]the execution [MASK]f an a[MASK]ostle[MASK]is a letter by Clement to the Corinthians traditional dated to around 96 A.D. The apocryphal Ascension of Isaiah , a Christian writing from the 2nd century says , " the slayer of his mother , who hi[MASK][MASK]elf ( even ) this king , will persecute the plant which the[MASK]Twelve Apostles of the Beloved have planted . Of the Twelve o[MASK]e will be delivered into his hands " was interpreted to mean Nero . 
 Bishop Eusebius of Caesarea ( c . 275 – 339 ) was the first to write explicitly that Paul was beheaded in Rome during the reign of Nero . He states that Nero 's persecution led to Peter and Paul 's deaths , but that Nero did not[MASK]give a[MASK]y specific orders . However[MASK], several other accounts going back to the 1st[MASK]century have Paul surviving his two years in Rome and travelling to Hispania , before facing trial in Rome again prior to his death . 
 [MASK]eter is first said to have been crucif[MASK]ed upside @-@ d[MASK]wn in Rome during Nero 's reign ( [MASK]ut not by Nero ) in the apocryphal Acts of Pete[MASK] ( c . 200 ) . The account ends with Paul still ali[MASK]e and Nero abiding by God 's c[MASK]mmand[MASK]not to persecute any more Christians . 
 By the 4th century , a number of writers were stating th[MASK]t Nero killed Peter and Paul . [MASK] 
 = = = = The Antichrist = = = = 
 
 The Sibylline[MASK]Oracles , Book 5 and 8 , writt[MASK]n in the 2nd century , speak of Nero returning and bringing destructi[MASK]n . Within Christian communities , these writings ,[MASK]along with others , fueled the belief that Nero would return as the Antichrist .[MASK]In[MASK]310 , Lactantius wrote that Nero " suddenly disappeared , and even the burial place of that noxious wild beast was nowhere to be seen . This has led some persons of extrav[MASK]gant imagination to suppose that , havi[MASK]g been conveyed to a distant region , h[MASK] is s[MASK]ill reserved alive ; and to him they apply the Sibylline verses " , Lactantius maintains that i[MASK] is not[MASK]right to believe this . 
 In 422 , Augustine of Hippo wrote about 2 [MASK]hessalonians 2 : 1 – 11 , where he believed Paul mentioned the coming of the Antichrist . Though he rejects th[MASK] theory [MASK] Augustine mentions that many Christians believed that Nero was [MASK]he Antichrist or would return as the An[MASK]i[MASK]hri[MASK]t . He wrot[MASK] , [MASK] so that in saying , ' For the [MASK]ystery of iniqui[MASK]y doth already work , ' he alluded to N[MASK]ro , whose deeds already seemed to be as the deeds of Antichrist . " 
 So[MASK]e modern biblical scholars such as Delbert Hillers[MASK]([MASK][MASK]ohns Hopkins Univ[MASK]rsity ) of the American Schools of Oriental Research and the editors of the Oxford & Harper Collins Study Bibles , contend tha[MASK] the number 666 in the Book of Revelation is a code for Nero , a view that is also supported in Roman Catholic Biblical commentaries . 
 The concept of Nero as the Antichrist is often a central belief of Preterist eschatology . 
 
 
 = Manila = 
 
 Manil[MASK] ( / məˈnɪl.ə / ) is the capital city of the Philippines , founded on June 24 , 1571 by Spanish conquistador Migu[MASK]l López de Legazpi . It is one of the oldest cities in the country and was the seat of power for [MASK]ost of the colonial rules of the Philippines . It is situated on the eastern shore of Manila Bay and contains a multi[MASK]ude of landmarks , some of which date back to[MASK]the 16th century , such as the Spanish colonial era Walled Ci[MASK]y of I[MASK]tramuros . 
 Ma[MASK]ila is the second most populous city in the Phi[MASK]ippines after the former capital Quezon City with a population of 1 @,@ 780 @,@ 148 in 20[MASK]5 . Because of its small land area and huge population , Manila is regarded as one of[MASK]the most densely popu[MASK]ated cit[MASK]es in the world with 42 @,@ 857[MASK]people [MASK]er square kilometer . Manila is one of the sixteen cities and a municipality that make up Metro Manila , the National Capital Region of the Philippines . In 2012 , Glob[MASK]lization and World C[MASK]ties[MASK]Researc[MASK] Network listed Manila as a globa[MASK] city . 
 Manila has six representative districts for the lower [MASK]ouse of the Philippine Congress . Furthermore , the city is composed of 16 districts , namely : Binondo , Ermita , Intramuros , Malate , P[MASK][MASK]o , Pandacan , Port Area , Quia[MASK]o , Sampaloc[MASK], Sa[MASK] Andres , San Miguel , San Nicolas , Santa Ana , Santa Cruz , Santa Mesa and Tondo . 
 The Kingdom of Ton[MASK]o onc[MASK][MASK]ruled in the vicinity of Manil[MASK] before it briefly became a province of[MASK]the Hindu Majapahit Empire . During the Brunei invasion [MASK]f the Philippines , Sultan[MASK]Bolkiah of Brunei captured [MASK]eludong ( a vill[MASK]ge in modern @-@ day Manila ) and renamed i[MASK][MASK]Maynilà , a Tagalog term refe[MASK]ring to the presence of the Nila shrub . Maynila was a vassal state of Brunei , established to overpower Tondo . Maynilà had been Indianized since the sixth century CE and earlier . It had become part[MASK]y [MASK]slamic and Hindu @-@ animist b[MASK] the 15th century CE . 
 In 1571 Spanish Conquistadors arrived from Me[MASK]ico , from across the Pacific , and founded present @-@ day Manila i[MASK] what today is Intramuro[MASK] . Spanish missionaries soon Christianized the city and incorporated Tondo under Manila and then built some[MASK]of the oldest churches in the country , including San Agustin Chu[MASK]ch . The Conquistad[MASK]rs renam[MASK]d the area Nuevo Reino de Castilla ( New Kingdom of Castille[MASK]) and shortened the name to M[MASK][MASK]ila . 
 Manila became the center of Spanish activity in the Far East and one en[MASK] [MASK]f [MASK]he Manila @-@ Acapulco Galleon trade route , linking Spa[MASK]ish America with Asia , one of the ea[MASK]liest examples of globalization . Due to the central loc[MASK]tion in the Pacific sea trade routes , Manila received [MASK]he moniker of the " Pearl of the Orient " . Spanish rule of Manila and the en[MASK]ire Philippine archipelago lasted for over three centuries , un[MASK]il 1898 . At different times during the long Spanish period there were local revolts , [MASK]hinese insurrections , massive pirate attacks , great earthquakes , Dutch [MASK]aids and invasion attempts , and a British occupation of the city dur[MASK]ng their unsuccessful attempt to conquer the Philippines . O[MASK]der was usua[MASK]ly quickly restored and the city returned to the business of trade . In th[MASK] 19th century Manila was one of the mos[MASK] modern cities in Asia . Before the [MASK]panish – American War , Manila saw the rise of the Philippine Revolution . Under the Am[MASK]rican rule following the Spanish – American War[MASK], the Un[MASK]ted States changed the offi[MASK]ial la[MASK]guage from Spanish to English[MASK]and made some changes in educ[MASK]tion , local l[MASK]ws and ur[MASK]an planning . Towards the end of World War II ,[MASK]during the Battle of Manila most of the cit[MASK] was flatt[MASK]n[MASK]d by intensive aerial bombardment b[MASK] the United[MASK]States Air Force . As a result , relatively [MASK]ittle remains of Manila 's prewar and colonial architecture , although there are ong[MASK]ing restoration projects , especially within the old w[MASK]lled city , Intramuros .  = = History = = 
 
 The earliest evidence of [MASK]uman life in and around the area of Manila is the nearby Angono Petroglyphs dated to around 3000 BC . Furthermore , negritos , a c[MASK]ass of Australoid peoples , became the aboriginal inhabitants of the Philippines . Th[MASK]y were found across Luzon before the Malayo @-@ Polynesians migrated in and assimilated them . 
 The Kingdom of To[MASK]do flourished during the[MASK]latter half of the Ming Dynasty [MASK]s a result of direct tra[MASK]e relations with China . Tondo district was ma[MASK]ntained as the traditional capital of the empire , with its rulers as sovereign kings and not mere chieftains , and[MASK]were addressed variously as panginuan ln Meranau or panginoón in Tagalog ( [MASK] lords " ) ; anák banwa ( " son of heaven " ) ; [MASK]r lakandula ( " lord of the palace " ) , the Emperor of China considered the Lakans [MASK] rulers of ancient Manila ) " 王 " ( K[MASK]ngs ) . 
 In the 13th century , Manila consisted of a fortified[MASK]settlement and trading quarter at the shores of the Pasig River , on top of previous old[MASK]r towns . [MASK]anila was then settled by the Indianized [MASK]mpire of Majapahit as referenced in the epic eulogy poem Nagarakretagama which inscribed its conquest by Maharaja Hayam Wuruk . Selurong " षेलुरोन ् [MASK] ् " which is a historical name for the city of M[MASK]nila is listed in Canto 14 alongside Sulot , which is now Sulu , and Kal[MASK]a . 
 During the reign of Sultan Bolkiah from 1485 to 1521 , the Bruneian Empi[MASK][MASK] invaded , wanting to take advantage of Tondo 's China trad[MASK] by attac[MASK]ing its environs and establishing " [MASK]وتا سلودوڠ Kota Saludong " ( The Kingdom of Maynila ) . They ruled under and gave yea[MASK]ly tribute to the Sul[MASK]anat[MASK] of Brunei as its satellite state . They es[MASK]a[MASK]lished a new dynasty under the local leader who accepted [MASK]slam and be[MASK]ame Rajah Salalila or [MASK]ariq Sulayman I. He also establish[MASK]d a trading challenge t[MASK] the a[MASK]r[MASK]ady rich[MASK]House of Lak[MASK]n Dula in Tondo . Islam was further strengthened by the arriv[MASK]l of Muslim traders from the Arab @-@ Indian area [MASK]nd Southeast Asia . [MASK]anila was t[MASK]mporarily besieged by the invasion of[MASK]Chinese [MASK]irate @-@ war[MASK]ord Limahong ( 1574 ) but was thwarted by the local[MASK]inhabitants , before it became[MASK]th[MASK] seat of the col[MASK]n[MASK]al government of Spain . 
 O[MASK] June 24 , 15[MASK]1 , Spanish conquistador Miguel López de Legazpi arri[MASK]ed from New Spain ( now Mex[MASK]co ) , and then exercised rule of the Spanish city of Manila as a territory of New Spain with the establis[MASK]ment of a city council in what today is the district of Intramuros . López de L[MASK]gazpi had the local royalty executed or exiled , after the failure of the To[MASK]do Conspiracy[MASK]; a plo[MASK] wherein an alliance between Japanese merchants , Luzon 's H[MASK]angs with several Datus and Rajahs plus the Br[MASK]neian Empire would band together to execute the Spaniards and their Latin @-@ Amer[MASK]can mercenaries , and Visayan allies . At the conclusion of which[MASK], the victorious Spaniards made Manila the capital of the Spanish East Indies and of the Philippines , which th[MASK] empire would control f[MASK]r the next three [MASK]enturies , from 15[MASK]5 to 1898 . 
 Manila then [MASK]ecame famous du[MASK]ing the Mani[MASK]a @-@ Acapulco Galleon trade which lasted for three centuries and[MASK]brought goods from Europe , Africa and Latin America across the Pacific Islands to [MASK]outheast[MASK]A[MASK]ia ( Which was already an entrepot for goods coming from [MASK]ndia , Indonesia and China ) and [MASK]rade al[MASK]o flowed vice ve[MASK]sa . Silver that was mined in Mex[MASK]c[MASK] and Peru were excha[MASK]ged for Chinese silk , Indian gems , and the spices of the Sou[MASK]heast Asia , some of which even flowed to Europe [MASK] Likewise wines and olives grown from Europe and North Africa were transshipped via Mexico towards Manila . 
 Manila was o[MASK]cupied by British forces for twenty months , from 1762 to 1764 , and used [MASK]s a[MASK]base for an unsuccessful a[MASK]tempt to con[MASK]uer the Philippines during the Seven Years[MASK]' War . Eventually , the British withdrew from Manila[MASK]as p[MASK]r agreements in the 1763 Treaty of Paris . [MASK]he Chinese were punished for supporting the British invasion , and the small fortress @-@ city of Intramu[MASK]os , mostly populat[MASK]d by Europeans and Mexicans , kept its cannons pointed at Binondo , the [MASK]orld 's oldest Chinatown . 
 Mexican Independe[MASK]ce in 1821 necessitated direct rul[MASK] from Spain . Under direct Spanish rule , banking , ind[MASK]stry and education flourished more than it had in the previou[MASK] two[MASK]centuries . The opening [MASK]f the Suez Canal in 1869 facilitated dir[MASK]ct trade and [MASK]ommunications with Spain . 
 The growing wealth and educ[MASK]tion attra[MASK]te[MASK] indigenou[MASK] , Chinese , Indi[MASK]ns , Latinos , and Europeans from the provinces to Manila , all of whom elected a nascent Filipino citizenship regardless of e[MASK]hnici[MASK]y . The developments also facilitated the rise of an illustrado class which [MASK]spoused libe[MASK]al ideas , the ideological foundations of the Philippine Revolution which sought independence from Spain . 
 After the Battle of Mani[MASK]a ( 1[MASK]98 ) , Spain ceded the surrendered city of Manila to the United States . The First Philippine Republic b[MASK]sed[MASK]at nearby Bulacan fought against the American[MASK] for control of the [MASK]ity of Manila . [MASK][MASK]e Americans defeated the First Philippine Republic and captured pres[MASK]dent Emilio Aguinaldo who announced allegiance to the United States on April 1 , 1901 . 
 Upon drafting a new charter for Manil[MASK] in June 1901 , t[MASK]e Americans made official what [MASK]ad long been tacit : that the City of Manila was not Intramuros alone but also all its arrabales . The new city charter proclaimed that [MASK]anila was composed of eleven municipal districts — [MASK]resum[MASK]bly Tondo , Binondo , Santa Cruz , Sampaloc , San Miguel , Pandacan , Santa Ana , Paco , Malate , Ermita and Intramuros . In addition to these , the Church recognized five parishes as Manileno — namely , Gagalangin , Trozo , Balic @-@ Bali[MASK] , Santa Mesa and Singalong . Later times would ad[MASK] two more : Balut and San Andres [MASK]ukid . 
[MASK]Under American control , a new civilian oriented Insular Government headed by then Gover[MASK]or @-@ General William Howard Taft invited city planner Da[MASK]iel Burnham for the trans[MASK]ormation of Manila , to adapt the old city to changed times an[MASK] modern nee[MASK]s . The Burnham Plan included develop[MASK]ent of the road system , the use of waterways for transportation ,[MASK]and beautif[MASK]cation of Manila with the improve[MASK]ent of waterfronts , construction of parks , parkways and var[MASK]ous building for various activities . 
 The latter included a government c[MASK]nter occupy[MASK]ng all of Wallace Field , wh[MASK]ch extends from Luneta to[MASK]the present Taft[MASK]Avenue . The Philippin[MASK] Ca[MASK]itol was to rise at the Taft Avenue end of the field , facing towar[MASK] the sea , and would f[MASK]rm , with t[MASK]e buildings of different government bureaus and departments , a quadrangle , lagoon in the center , and a monument to José R[MASK]zal a[MASK] its Luneta end . Of[MASK]Burnham 's proposed gov[MASK]rnment center , only three unit[MASK] — [MASK]he[MASK]Legislative Building and the building[MASK]of the Finance and[MASK]Agricultural departments — were completed when World War II [MASK]rupted . 
 Due to t[MASK]e Japanese occupation of the Philippines , Ameri[MASK]an soldiers were ordered to withdraw[MASK]from the ci[MASK]y an[MASK] all military installations were removed on December 24 , 1941 . General D[MASK]uglas MacArthur declared Manil[MASK] an open city to prevent further death an[MASK] destr[MASK]ction ; de[MASK]pite this , the Japanese warplanes continued to bomb the[MASK]city . Manila was occupied by the Japanese forc[MASK]s on [MASK]anuary 2 , 1942 . 
 Manila was also the site of the bloodiest battle in the Pacific theater during the Second World War . After fa[MASK]ling to the Empire of Japan on January 2 , 1942 , [MASK][MASK] was recaptured by joint American and Filipino troops from February 3 to March 3 , 1945 . Some 100 @,@ 000 civilians were killed in Manila in February 1945 . It was the second most devastated city i[MASK] the world after Warsaw[MASK]during the Second World War . At the end of World W[MASK][MASK] II , almost all of [MASK]he structures in the city , particularly Intramuros , wer[MASK] destroy[MASK]d but after the war , reconstruc[MASK]ion took place . 
 In 1948 , President Elpidio Quirino moved the seat of government of the P[MASK]ilippines to Quezon City[MASK], a new capital city in the suburbs and fields nor[MASK]heast of Manila , created in 1938 by former President Manuel L. Quezon , which was named after him . The move ended any[MASK]implementation of the Burnham Plan 's[MASK]intent for the government centre to be at Luneta . 
 With the Visayan @-@ born Arsenio Lacson as its first elected mayor in 1952 ( all mayors were appointed pr[MASK]or to this ) , Manila underwen[MASK] The Golden Ag[MASK] , once again earning its status as[MASK]th[MASK] " Pearl [MASK]f th[MASK] Orient " , a moniker it earned before the Second World War . After Lacson 's term in the 1950s , Manila was led by Antonio Villegas for most of [MASK]he 1960s . Ramon Bagatsing ( an Indian @-@ Filipino ) was mayor for nearly the entire 1970[MASK] until the 1986 People Power Revolution . Mayors Lacson , Vil[MASK]egas , and Bagatsing are often collectively [MASK][MASK]nside[MASK]ed as the[MASK]" Big[MASK]Three of Manila " less for their rather long tenures as the city 's chief executive ( continuously for over three decades , [MASK]rom 1952 – 1986 ) , but more for their indelible[MASK]contribution to the development and progress of the city and their lasting legacy in uplifting the qual[MASK]ty of life and welfare of the people of [MASK]anila . 
 During the a[MASK]ministration of President Ferdinand Marcos[MASK], the region of the Metro Manila was created as an integrated unit with the enactment of Presidential Decree No. 824 on November 7 , 1975 . The area encompassed four cities and thirteen adjoining towns , as a sep[MASK]rate regional unit of government . On the 4[MASK]5th anniversary of the city 's foundation on [MASK]une 24 , 1976 , Manila was[MASK]re[MASK]nstated by Marcos as the capital of the Philippines for its historical significance as the seat of government since the Spanish Period . President[MASK]al Decree [MASK]o. 940 states [MASK]hat Manila has alwa[MASK]s been to the Filipino people and in the eyes of [MASK]he world , the premier city of the Philippines being the center of trade , commerce , education and culture . 
 During the martial law era , Manila became a hot @-@ bed of resistance activity as youth and student demonstrators repeatedly clashed with the police and [MASK]ilitary [MASK]hich were subservient to the Marcos regime . After dec[MASK]des of resistan[MASK]e , the non @-@ violent People Power Revolution ( predecessor to the peace[MASK]ul @-@ revolutions that toppled the iron[MASK]@-@ curtain in Europe ) , ous[MASK]ed the authoritarian[MASK]Marcos from power . 
 In 1992 , Alfr[MASK]do Lim was elected mayor , [MASK]he first Chinese @-@ Filipino to[MASK]hold the office . He w[MASK]s known for his anti @-@ crime crusades . Lim was succeeded[MASK]by Lito Atienza , who served as his vice @-@ mayor . Atienza was known for his campaign ( and city slogan ) " Buhayi[MASK] ang Maynila " ( Revive Manila ) , which saw the establishment [MASK]f several parks and th[MASK] repair and re[MASK]abilitation of the city 's deteriorating facilities . He was the city 's mayor f[MASK]r 3 terms ([MASK]9 years ) before being termed out of[MASK]office . 
 Alfredo Lim once [MASK]gain ran for mayor and defeated Atienza 's son Ali in the 2[MASK]07[MASK]city election and immediately reversed a[MASK]l of Atienza 's projects claiming Atienza 's projects made little c[MASK]ntribution to the improv[MASK]men[MASK]s of the cit[MASK] . The relationship of both [MASK]arties turned bitter , with the t[MASK]o pitting again during the 2010 city elections in which Lim won against Atienza . 
 Lim was sued by councilor Dennis Alcoreza on 2008 ove[MASK] human rights , charg[MASK]d with[MASK]graft o[MASK]er the rehabilitation of public schools , and was he[MASK]vily criticized for his h[MASK]ph[MASK]zard resolution of [MASK]he Rizal Park hostage taking incident , one of the deadliest hostage crisis in the Phi[MASK]ippines . Later on , Vice Mayor Isko Moreno and [MASK]8 city councilors filed another case against Lim in 2012 , s[MASK]ati[MASK]g that Lim 's statement in a meeting were " life @-@ threat[MASK]ning " to them . On the 2013 elections , former President Joseph Estrada defeated Lim in the mayo[MASK]al race . During his term , Estra[MASK]a has paid the city 's over ₱ [MASK] billion [MASK]ebts , increase revenues by 2 @.@ 35 times from ₱ 6 @.@ 2 billion in 2012 to ₱ 14 @.@ 6 billion by 2016 , spent from 2013 to 2016 an unprecedented ₱ 6 @.@ 76 billion for the city 's infrastruc[MASK]ure , built and[MASK]or renovated seven city public markets , b[MASK]ilt 22 s[MASK]hools , increased teachers [MASK] incomes , modernized the six city hospitals and bought dialysis machines and magnetic resonance [MASK]maging scanners , increased the efficiency of the police force and reduced crime . Ma[MASK]ila has become the most competitive city in the Philippines b[MASK] 2015 , making the city the best plac[MASK] for doing business and for li[MASK]ing in . 
 Despite his achievements and un[MASK]recedented feat as the Mayor of Manila , however , Estrada was re @-@ elected as Manila mayor in the 2016 ele[MASK]tion against Lim and Amado Bagatsing , only winning by an infinitesimal 2 [MASK],@ 830 votes . 
 
 = = Geograph[MASK] = = [MASK] 
 Mani[MASK]a is located on the eastern shores of Manila bay , which rests on the western shores of Luzon . Manila [MASK]ies 800 miles ( 1 @,@ 300 kilometers[MASK][MASK] from mainland Asia . The Pasig River bisects Manila . 
 Almost all of Manila sits on top of centuries of prehistoric alluvial deposits built by the waters of the Pasig and [MASK]n some land reclaimed from Manila Bay . Manila 's land has been altered substantially by human interventi[MASK]n [MASK] with considerable land reclamation along the waterfronts since the American colo[MASK]ial times .[MASK]Some of the natural [MASK]ariations in topography have been evened out due to the urbanization of the city . As of 2013 , Manila[MASK]has a total[MASK]area of 42 @.@ 88 square kilometres ( 16[MASK]@.@ 56 sq mi ) . 
 
 = = = Earthquakes = = = 
 [MASK] Manila sits astride the Pacific typhoon belt and is criss @-@ crossed by several fault lines . This[MASK]led to Manila[MASK]and its metropolitan r[MASK]gion to be ranked as the second riskiest capital ( city ) [MASK]o live in according to Swiss Re . The seismically active Marikina V[MASK]lley F[MASK]ult System poses a threat to Manila and the surroun[MASK]ing regions . 
 Manila has endured several deadly earthquakes , notably in 1645 and in 1677 w[MASK]ich destroyed the stone and brick medieval city . The Earthquake Baroque style was used by[MASK]the Colonial architec[MASK]s d[MASK]ring the Spanish colonial p[MASK]riod in order to adapt to the fre[MASK]uent earthquakes .

 = = = Climate = = = 
 
 Under the Köppe[MASK] climate cla[MASK]sification system , Manila features a tropical savanna climate ( Köppen climate classification Aw ) . Together with the rest of the Philippines[MASK], Manila lies entirely within the tropics . Its proximity to the equator means that the temperature range is very small , rar[MASK]ly going [MASK]elow 20 ° C ( 68 ° F[MASK]) or abov[MASK] 38 ° C ( 100 ° F ) . Temperature extremes have ranged from 14 @.@ 5 ° C ( 58 @.@ 1 ° F ) on January [MASK]1 , 1914 to 38 @.@ 6 ° C ( 101 @.@ 5 ° F[MASK]) on May 7 , 1915 . 
 Humidity levels are usuall[MASK] very high all year rou[MASK]d . Manila has a distinct dry season [MASK]rom December through May , and a relatively lengthy wet season that covers the remainin[MASK] [MASK]eriod with slightly cooler temperatures . In th[MASK] rainy season it rarely rains all day but the rainfall is very heavy during short periods . Typhoons usually occur from June to September . 
 
 = = = Environment = = = 
 
 D[MASK]e to industrial waste and automobiles , Manila suffers from air pollution , affecting 98 % of the population . Annually , the air pollution causes more than 4 @,@ 000 deaths . Ermita is[MASK]Mani[MASK]a 's most air [MASK]olluted district due to open dump sites and industrial waste . According to a report [MASK]n 2003 , The Pasig River is one of the most p[MASK]lluted rivers in the world with 150 tons of domestic w[MASK]ste and 75 tons of ind[MASK]strial waste dumped daily . 
 Annually , Manila[MASK]is hit with 6 to 7 typhoons creating floods[MASK][MASK] In 2009 , Typhoon Kets[MASK]na struck [MASK]hilippines . In the aftermath of Typhoon Ketsana , the lack of infrastructure led to [MASK]ne of the wo[MASK]st floodings in the Philippines and creating a significant amount of pol[MASK]ution . Following the aftermath of Typhoon Ketsana , the city began to d[MASK]edge[MASK]its rivers[MASK]and improve its drainage networ[MASK] . The Pasig [MASK]iver Rehabilitation Co[MASK]mission[MASK]is in charge of cleaning up the Pasig River and tributaries for tra[MASK]sportation , recreation and tou[MASK]ism purposes . Rehabilitation efforts [MASK]ave resulted in the creation of parks along the riverside , a[MASK]ong wit[MASK] stricter pollution controls[MASK]. 
 
 = = Cityscape[MASK]= = 
 
 
 = [MASK] = Architecture = = = 
 
 Manila has archi[MASK]ecturally significant buildings in a wide range of styles spanning distinct historical and cultural periods . Arc[MASK]itectural styles reflect American , Spanish , Chine[MASK]e , and Malay influences . Prominet Filipino architects such as Antonio Toledo , Felipe Roxas , Juan M. Arell[MASK]no and Tomás Mapúa have designed[MASK]signific[MASK]nt bu[MASK]ldings in Manila such as churches , government offices , theaters , mansions , schools and universities . 
 Manila is known for its distinct Art Deco theaters [MASK]hich are designed by National A[MASK]tists such as Juan N[MASK]kpil a[MASK]d Pablo Antonio . The historic Escolta[MASK]Street in Binondo features many buildings of neo @-@ classical and beaux @-@ arts[MASK]architectura[MASK] style[MASK], many of which we[MASK]e designed by prominent Filipino architects [MASK]uring the American Rule in the 1920s to the late 1930s . Many archi[MASK]ects , artists , historians and heritage advocacy groups are pushing for the reviva[MASK] of Escolta Street , which wa[MASK] once the p[MASK]emier street of the Philip[MASK]ines . 
 Unfortunately , much of Manila 's[MASK]prewar and Spanish colonial architecture was destroyed duri[MASK]g World War II . Reconstruction took place afterwards , replacing the destroyed hi[MASK]toric Spanish @-@ era buildings with modern ones , erasing much of the city 's character . Some buildings destroyed by the war have been rec[MASK]nstructed , such as the Old Legisl[MASK]tive[MASK]Building ( National Museum ) , Ayunta[MASK]iento de Manila ( Bureau [MASK]f the Treasury ) and the currently under c[MASK]nstruction San Ignacio Church ( Museo de[MASK]Intr[MASK]muros ) . Plans have been laid out to rehabilitate se[MASK][MASK]ral neglected histo[MASK]ic [MASK]uildings and places such[MASK]as Plaza Del Car[MASK]en , San Sebastian Church and the Manila Metropolitan Theater and soon Spanish @-@ e[MASK]a shops and houses in Quiapo , Binondo , and San Nicolas will be restored to its former splendor , as a part of a movement to restore Manila to its former glory . 
 Since Manila is [MASK][MASK]one to earthquakes , the Spanish colonial architects invented the style called Earthqu[MASK]ke Baroque which the churches a[MASK]d government buildings during the Spani[MASK]h colonial period adopted . As a result , succeeding earthquakes of the 18th and 1[MASK]t[MASK] centuries barely affected Manila , although it did periodic[MASK]lly level[MASK]the surroundin[MASK] [MASK]rea . Modern buildings in and around Manila are designed or [MASK]ave retrofitted to withs[MASK]and an 8 @.@ 2 magnitude q[MASK]ake in accordance to the country 's building code . 
 
 = = = Barangays and districts = = = 
 
 Manila is compose[MASK] of four[MASK]een districts according to Republ[MASK]c Act No. 409 , otherwise known as the Rev[MASK]sed Charter of the City of Manila . Two were later added , [MASK]hich are Santa Mesa ( partiti[MASK]ned off from[MASK]Sampal[MASK]c ) and San Andres ( partitioned off from[MASK]Santa Ana ) . 
 T[MASK]e city has 896 barangays that are known by sequential numbers instead of names . These barangays are further group into 100 zones for administrative and municipal pur[MASK]oses .

 = = Demog[MASK]aphics = = 
 
 According to the 2015 census , t[MASK]e population of the city was 1 @,@ 780 @,@ 148 , making it th[MASK][MASK]second most populous city in the Philippines . 
 Manila is the most densely po[MASK]ulated city in the world with[MASK]43 @,@ 079 inhabitants per km2 . District 6 is listed as being the most dense w[MASK]th 68 @[MASK]@ 266 inha[MASK]itants per k[MASK]2 , followed by District 1 with 64 @,@ 936 and Di[MASK]trict 2 with 64 @,@ 710 , respectively . Di[MASK]trict 5 is t[MASK]e least densely populated area with 19 @,@ 235 . 
 Manila 's population density dw[MASK]rfs that of Kolkata ( 27 @,@ 774 inhabitants per km2 ) , Mum[MASK]ai ( 22 @,@ 937 inhab[MASK]tants per km2 ) , Paris ( 20 @,@ 164 inhabitants per km2 ) ,[MASK]Dhak[MASK] ( 19 @,@ 447 inhabitants per k[MASK]2 ) , Shanghai ( 16 @,[MASK] 364 inhabitants per km2 , with its most dense district , Nanshi , having a[MASK]density of 56 @,@ 785 inhabi[MASK]ants per km2 ) , and Tokyo ( 10 @,@ 087 inhabitan[MASK]s per km2 ) . 
 The vernacular language is Filipino , based mostly on the[MASK]Tagalog of surrounding areas , and this Ma[MASK]ila form of [MASK]peaking Tagalog has essentially become the lingu[MASK] franca of the Philippines , having spread throughout [MASK]he archipelago through mass media and entertainme[MASK]t . Meanwhile , English is the language most widely used in education , business , and heavily in everyday usage throughout the Metro Manila re[MASK]ion [MASK][MASK]d the Philip[MASK]ines[MASK]itself . 
 A number of older residents can still speak basic Spanish , [MASK]hich used to be a ma[MASK]dat[MASK]ry subject in the curriculum of Philippine universities and colleges , and many children of Japanese Filipino , Indian Filipino , and other [MASK]igrants or expatriates also speak their parents ' languages at home , aside f[MASK]om [MASK]nglish and / or Filipin[MASK][MASK]for every[MASK]ay use . Minnan Chinese ( known as Lannang @-@ oe ) is s[MASK]oken by the city 's Chinese @-@ Filipino community . 
 
 = = Economy [MASK] = [MASK] 
 Th[MASK] [MASK]ity is a major center for commerce , banking and finance , retailing , transportation , tourism ,[MASK]real estate , new media as well as traditional media , advertising , legal services , accountancy , insurance , theater , fashion , and[MASK]the arts i[MASK] the Philippines . 
 The Cit[MASK]es and Municipalitie[MASK] Competitiveness Index , publis[MASK]ed by the National Competitiveness Council of the Philippines , ranks the cities [MASK] mun[MASK]cipalities and provinces of the cou[MASK]try according to their economic dynamism , government efficiency and infr[MASK]structure . Manila placed third in the Highly Urbanized City ( HUC ) category . Previousl[MASK][MASK],[MASK]Manila was the country 's most competitive city in 2015 , making it the best p[MASK]ace to live in and d[MASK] business . 
 The Port of Manila i[MASK] the largest seaport in the Philippines , making it the pre[MASK]ier internatio[MASK]al shipping gat[MASK]way to the country . The Philippine[MASK]Ports Authority is government agency responsi[MASK]le to oversee the operation [MASK]nd management of the ports . The International Container Terminal Services Inc. cited by the Asian Development Bank as one of the top five major maritime terminal operators in the world has its headquarters and main operation[MASK] o[MASK] the ports of Manila . Another port operator , the Asian Terminal Incorpo[MASK]ated [MASK] has its corporat[MASK] office and main operations in the Manila South Harbor and its conta[MASK]ner depository located in Santa Mesa . 
 Binondo , the oldest and one of the largest Chinatown [MASK]n the world , was the center of commerce a[MASK]d business activities in th[MASK] ci[MASK]y . Nume[MASK]ous residential and office skyscrapers are found within its medieval streets . Plans to make the Chinatown area into a busin[MASK]s[MASK] process outsourcing ( BPO ) hub progresses and is aggres[MASK]ively pursued by the[MASK]city government of Man[MASK]la . 30 buildings are[MASK]already [MASK]dentified to be converted [MASK][MASK]to BPO offices . These buildings are mostly located along the Escolta Street of Binondo , which are all unoccupied [MASK]nd [MASK]an be converted [MASK]nto offices . 
 Divisoria in Tondo is dubbed[MASK]as the " shopping mecca of the Philippines [MASK] . Numerous shopping malls are located in this place , which sells produc[MASK]s and goods at bargain price . S[MASK]all vendors occupies several roads that causes pedestrian and vehicular traffic . A famous landmark in Divisoria is the Tutuban Center , a[MASK]large shopping mall that is a part of the Philippine National Rail[MASK]ays ' Main Station . It attracts 1 mil[MASK]io[MASK][MASK]people every month , but is expected[MASK]to add another 40[MASK] @,@ 000 people when the LRT @-@ 2 West Extension is constructed , making it Manila 's bus[MASK][MASK]st transfer station . 
 Diverse manufacturers within the city produce indust[MASK]ial @-@ related products such as chemicals , textiles , clothing , [MASK]nd electronic goods . Food and bevera[MASK]es and tobacco products also produced . Local entrepreneurs continue to p[MASK]oces[MASK] prima[MASK]y commodities for export , including rope , plywood , refin[MASK]d sugar , copra , and coconut oil . The food @-@ p[MASK]ocessing industry is one of the most stable major manufacturing sector in the city . 
 The Pandacan Oil Depo[MASK] houses the storage facilities and distribution ter[MASK]inals of the three major players in [MASK]he country 's petrole[MASK]m industry , namely Caltex Philippines , Pilipinas Shell and Pe[MASK]ron Corporation . The oil depot has been a subject of various [MASK]oncerns , including its environmental and health impact to the residents of Manila . T[MASK]e Supreme Court has ordered that the oil depot to be reloc[MASK]ted outside the city by July 2015 , but it failed to meet this deadline . It is currently being demolished which is ex[MASK]ected to be finished before the year 2016 ends , and plans have been set up to turn this 33 hectare [MASK]acility into a transport hub or even a food park . 
 Manila is a major publishing center in the Philippines . Manila Bulletin , the Phili[MASK]pines ' largest broadsheet newspape[MASK] by circulation , is headquartered inside Intramuros . Other major publishin[MASK] companies in the country like The Manila Times ,[MASK]The[MASK]Philippine Star and Manila Standard Today are headquartered inside the Port Area . The [MASK]h[MASK]nese Commercial News , the Philippines '[MASK]oldest existing Chinese @-@ language newspape[MASK] , and the count[MASK]y[MASK]'s third @-@ oldest e[MASK]isti[MASK]g newspaper is headquartered in Binondo [MASK] 
 Manila serves as the headquarters of the Central Bank of the Philippines which is located [MASK]long Roxas Boulevard . Some universal banks in the Philippines that has its head[MASK]uarters in the city are the Landbank of the Philippines and Philippine Trust Company[MASK]. Philam Life Insurance Company , currently[MASK]the largest life insurance company in the Philippines in te[MASK]ms of assets , net worth , investment and paid @-@ up capital , has it[MASK] headquarters along United Nations Avenue in Ermita . Unilever Philippines has its corporate office along United Nations Avenu[MASK] in Paco . Toyota , a compan[MASK] lis[MASK]ed in the Forbes Global 2000 also has its regional[MASK]office along UN Av[MASK]nue . 
 
 = = [MASK] Tourism = = = 
 
 Tourism is [MASK] vital industry[MASK]in Manila , and it welcomes approximatel[MASK] over 1 milli[MASK]n tourists [MASK]ach year . Major destinations include the[MASK]walled city of Intramuros , the National Theater at the Cultural C[MASK]nter of the Philippi[MASK]es , Manila Ocean Park [MASK] Binondo , Ermita , Malate , Manila Zoo , [MASK]ational Museum of the Philippines and Rizal Park . 
 Rizal Park , also known as Luneta Park , is the national park of the country and has an area of 58 hectares ( 140 acres ) , making it th[MASK] largest[MASK]urban park in Asia . In the Tourism Act of 2009 , Rizal Park[MASK]along w[MASK]th Intramuros are designated as flagship destination to become a tourism enterprise zone . A new att[MASK]action called Paseo de Manila i[MASK] expecte[MASK] to [MASK]ise in [MASK]he park . The park was constructed as an honor and dedication to the country [MASK]s national hero José Rizal , who was executed b[MASK] the Spaniards on charges of subversion . The flagpole west of the Rizal Monument i[MASK] the Kilometer Zero marker for distances to the rest of the country . 
 Intramuros is the historic center of Manila . Originally[MASK], it was considered to be Manila itself at the time when the Philippines was under the Spanish Empire colonial rule . Owing to its history and cultural value , Intramuros and Rizal [MASK]ark are designated as flagship destination to [MASK]ecome a tourism enter[MASK]rise zone in the Tourism Act of 2009 . Intramuros is managed by the Intramuros[MASK]Administration ( IA ) . 
 The architect[MASK]re of Intramuros reflects the Spanish colonial style and the Ameri[MASK]an neoclassical architectural style , [MASK]ince the Philippines was a colony of Spain and the United States before it i[MASK] granted its independence in 1946 . Kalesa is a popular mode of transportation in Intramuros and nearby pla[MASK]es such as Binondo , Ermita and the Rizal Park . 
 Popular tourist de[MASK]tinations in Intramuros include the Baluarte de San Diego , Club Intramuros Golf Course , Cuartel de Santa Lucia , F[MASK]rt Santiago , Manila Cathedral , Palacio Arzobispal , Palacio de Santa Potenciana , Palacio del Gobernador , Plaza Mexico , Plaza de Roma , San Agustin Churc[MASK] and the Ayuntamiento de Man[MASK]la .  = = Government and politics = = 
 
 The government of Manila is divided into three branches : [MASK]xecutive , legislative and judiciary . The judicial branch is[MASK]administered solely by the Supreme Court of the Philippines under the Metro Manila judicial region . The c[MASK]ty governme[MASK]t have control of the executive and legislative branch . Manila employs 11 @,@ 919 [MASK]ersonnel at the end of 2014 . 
 The current Mayor of Manila is Joseph Estrada , who served as the President of the Philippines from 1998 @-@ 2001 . He is also the head of the executive department of the city . The legislative arm which is composed of six elected city councilors , is headed by the Vice Mayor . Fo[MASK]mer[MASK]actor [MASK]sk[MASK] Moreno curren[MASK][MASK]y serves as the city 's vice mayor . Altogether they a[MASK]e assisted by the Manila City Council , the local President of the Association of Barangay Captains , and the President of the Sang[MASK]uniang Kabataan . Their offices are located at the Mani[MASK]a City Hall .

 Am[MASK]ng the local government units , Manila has th[MASK] high[MASK]st budget allocation to health . It was also one of the[MASK]cities with the highest tax and i[MASK]ternal revenue . Tax revenue accounts for 46 % of the city 's inco[MASK]e in 2012 . 
 
 = = = Districts and barangays = = = 
 
 Manila has six legislat[MASK]ve districts that serve a[MASK] the constituencies for the elect[MASK]on of the city 's representatives to the lower house of the Congress [MASK]f [MASK]he Philippines and of the regular members to the Sangguniang Panlungsod ( SP ; City Council ) . Each distric[MASK] elects one representative to the House of Representatives an[MASK] six SP members to the council . The city , along with the rest of the nation , elects 12[MASK]senators as one at @-@ large district . 
 Manila is politically divided into 896 barangays , the smallest unit [MASK]f local government in the Philippines . Each barangay has its own chairperson a[MASK]d councilors . For administrative convenience , all the barangays i[MASK] Manila are grouped into 100 zones . These zones have no form of local government . 
 The 1st District ( 2015 popula[MASK]ion : 415 @,@ 906 ) is Manila 's ( and the country 's ) most densely populated congressio[MASK]al district . It covers the western portion of Tondo that lies along Manila Bay . 
 The 2nd District ( 2015 population : 215 @,@ 457 ) covers the eastern inland portion of[MASK]Tondo , a neighborhood or sub @-@ district known as Gagalangin . 
 The[MASK]3rd District ( 2015 population : 197 @,@ 242 ) cover[MASK] Binondo , Quiapo ,[MASK]San Nicolas and Santa Cruz . 
 The 4th Di[MASK]trict ( 2015 population : 265 @,@ 046 ) covers Sampaloc . 
 Th[MASK] 5th District ( 2015 population : 366 @,@ 714 ) covers Ermita ,[MASK]Malate , Port Area , I[MASK]tramuros , San Andres Bukid , and a portion of Paco ( [MASK]xcept Zone 90 ) . 
 The 6th District ( 2007 populat[MASK]on : 295 @,@ 245 ) covers Pac[MASK] ( Zone 90 only ) , Pandacan , San Miguel , Santa Ana and S[MASK]nta Mesa . 
 Manila has [MASK]he most number of barangays of an[MASK] city or[MASK]municipality in the Philippines . Attempts at reducing its number have not prospered despite local legislation — Ordinance 7907 , passed on 23 April 1[MASK]96 — reducing the number from 897 to 150 by merging e[MASK]isting barangays , because of the failure to hold a plebiscite . 
 
 = = = National government = = = 
[MASK]
 Manila , being the seat of political power of the Philippines , has several nati[MASK]nal government offices headquartered at the city . Planning [MASK]or the development for being the center of government started during the early years [MASK]f American colonization to the[MASK]country when they envisioned a well @-@ designed city outside the walls of Intramuros . The strategic location chosen was Bagumbayan , a former town which is now the Rizal Park to become the [MASK]enter of government and a [MASK]esign commissio[MASK] was given to Daniel Burnham to create a master plan for the city patterned after Washington[MASK]D.C .. These impr[MASK]vements were eventually abandoned under the Commonwealth Go[MASK]ernment of Manuel L. Quezon . 
 A new government center [MASK]as to b[MASK] built on the hills northeast of Manila , [MASK]r what is now Quezon City . Several government agencies have set up their headquarters in[MASK]Quezon City but several key government offices still reside in Manila . [MASK]owever , many of [MASK]he plans were substantially altered after[MASK]the devastation of Manila during World War II and by subsequent administrations . 
 The city , as the capital , s[MASK]ill hosts the Office of the Pre[MASK]ident[MASK], as w[MASK]ll as the president 's official residence . Aside from these , impor[MASK]ant ins[MASK]ituti[MASK]ns such as the Supreme Court , the Court of Appeals , the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas , the Departments of Budget and Management , Finance , [MASK]eal[MASK]h , Justice , Labor and Employment and Public Works and Hi[MASK]hways still call the[MASK]city home . Manila also hosts important national i[MASK]stitutions such as the National Library , National Archives , National Museum and the Philipp[MASK]ne General Hospital . 
 Congress previously held office at the Old Congress [MASK]uild[MASK]ng . In 1972 , due to declaration of martial law , Congress was dissolved ; its successor , the unic[MASK]meral Batasang Pambansa , h[MASK]ld office at the new Batasang Pambansa Complex . When a new consti[MASK]utio[MASK][MASK]restored the bicameral Congress , the House o[MASK] Representatives stayed at the Batasang Pambansa Complex , while the Senate rema[MASK]ned at the Old Congress Building . In May 1997 , the Senate transferred to a new building[MASK]i[MASK] shares with the Government Service Insurance System at reclaimed land at Pasay .

 In 2006 , Forbes magazine ranked Manila " the wo[MASK]ld 's most c[MASK]ngested city " . Manila has become notorio[MASK]s for its frequent traffic jams and high densities . The government has undertak[MASK]n seve[MASK]al projects to alleviate the traffic in the [MASK]ity . Some of the projects include : the construction of a new flyover at Sampaloc , the construc[MASK]ion of the Metro Manil[MASK] Skyway Stage 3 , the proposed LRT Line 2 ( west ) extension from Recto to Tondo or the Po[MASK]t Area , and the expansion of several national and local roads .  = = Global outreach = = 
 
 
 = = = Twin towns – Sister ci[MASK]ies = = = 
 
 Sister cities of Manila 
 
 = = = = Asia / Pacific Rim = = = =[MASK]
 
 
 = = = = North America = = = = 
 
 
[MASK]
 = Attalea ( palm ) = 
 
 Attalea is a large genus of palms native to Mexico , the Caribbean , C[MASK]ntral and [MASK]ou[MASK]h America .[MASK]This pinn[MASK]tely leaved , non @-@ spiny genus includes both small palms lacking an aboveground stem and large trees . The genus has a complic[MASK]ted taxonomic history , and has often been split into four or five genera based on differences in the male flowers . Since the genera can only be distinguished on the basis of their male f[MASK]owers , the existence of intermediate flower types and the existen[MASK]e of hybrids between different genera has[MASK]been used as an argument fo[MASK] keeping them all in the same genus . This has been supported by a recent molecul[MASK]r phylogeny . 
 Somewhere [MASK]etween 29 and 67 species are recognised in the genus , with estimates of as many as 1[MASK]0 . Incomplete herbarium collections make it difficult to determine[MASK]whether certain groups represent single species , or gr[MASK]ups of similar species . Attalea species have a long history of human use , [MASK]nd include economically important sources of p[MASK]lm oil and fibre . Many species are fire tolerant[MASK]a[MASK]d thrive in disturbed habitats . Their seeds are anima[MASK] dispersed , including some wh[MASK]ch are thought to have been adapted [MASK]or dispersal by now @-@ extinct Pleistocene megafauna . 
 
 =[MASK]= Description = =[MASK]
 
 The [MASK]enus[MASK]Attale[MASK] has pinnately compound leaves — rows of leaflets emerge on either side of the axis of the leaf in a feather @-@ like or fern @-@ like pattern . Species are also non @-@ spiny palms a[MASK]d includes both large trees with stout stems up to 30 metres ( 98[MASK]ft ) tall and[MASK]acaulescent palms ( one which lack an above[MASK]roun[MASK] s[MASK]em ) . The number of leaves per individual varies from about three to thirty @-@ five ; larger pla[MASK]ts tend[MASK]to have more and longer leaves . 
 Inflorescences are large , branched and borne among the leaves [MASK] The inflorescen[MASK]e consists of a main axis — the[MASK]peduncle and the rachis — and[MASK]a series of smaller branches , the rachillae . The rachillae , which bear the fl[MASK]wers , emerge from the rachis . The peduncle is the main stalk , connecting the rachis with the stem . Inflorescences either consist entirely of male flowers , or are predomina[MASK][MASK]ly female with a few male flowers . F[MASK]uit usually have two or three seeds , although fewer or more are present in some species , and are usually brown , yello[MASK] , orange @-[MASK] brown or purple when mature . 
 Four different types of male flowers[MASK]exist . On the basis of these flower types , the genus has often been split into four genera — a more narrowly defined Attalea ,[MASK]Orbignya , Maximiliana an[MASK] Scheelea . The species sometimes referred to Orbignya have coiled anthers , while the other groups[MASK]have straight ones . The pe[MASK]als of those placed in Maximiliana are much shorter than th[MASK] stamens , while those placed in Scheelea and a mor[MASK] narrowly defined Attalea ha[MASK]e [MASK]etals that are longer than the stamens . Five species do not fit easily into any of these groups ; t[MASK]is fact has been use[MASK] as an argument in favour of considering this group a sin[MASK]le genus . 
 
 = = Taxonomy = = 
 
 Attalea has been placed in the subfamily Arecoideae [MASK] the tribe Cocoseae and the subtribe Attaleinae , together with the genera Allagoptera , Beccariophoenix , Butia , Cocos , Jubaea , Jubaeopsis , Ly[MASK]oca[MASK]yum , Parajubaea [MASK] Syagrus and Voanioala . Withi[MASK] this s[MASK]btribe , Attalea has been found to be a monophyletic group , and sister to the clade containing Allagoptera , Polyandrococos , Parajubaea , Butia and Jubaea . 
 Disagreement exists as to whether Attalea should be considered[MASK]a single genus , or a group of related ge[MASK]era . In their 1996 Field G[MASK]ide to the Palms of the Americas , Andrew Henderson , Gloria Galeano and Rodrigo Berna[MASK] combined all the specie[MASK] in the subtribe Attaleinae ( as it was then defined ) into a single genus , Attalea . In his 1999 Taxonomic Treatment of Palm Subtribe Attaleinae , American botan[MASK]st Sidney F. Glassman divided the group [MASK]nto five genera — a more narrowly defined Attalea , Orbignya , Max[MASK]miliana , Scheelea and Ynesa . Rafäel Govaerts and John Dransfield recognised a single genus in their 2005 World Checklist of Palms , a[MASK]d Jean @-@ Christophe Pintaud continued th[MASK]s usage in his 2008 review of the genus . [MASK] The [MASK]ulti @-@ gen[MASK]s approach is based solely on t[MASK]e structure of t[MASK]e male flowers ; no other characters could be consistently associated with one genus or another . Four of the genera — Attalea ( in a narrow sense ) , Orbignya , Maximiliana and Scheele[MASK] — correspond to four different typ[MASK]s of male flowers found wi[MASK]hin the genus . However , a few species have flowers that are intermediate between these four types , including A.[MASK]colenda ( which Glassman placed in its own genus , Ynesa ) and this has been used as an argumen[MASK] for the s[MASK]ngle[MASK]@-@ genus approach . In addition , there are several hybrids between species that would be considered different genera under Glassman 's five @-@ genus system , which has also been used as an argument for placi[MASK]g them in a single genus .[MASK]In [MASK]009 Alan Meerow and co[MASK]leagues published a molecu[MASK]ar phyloge[MASK]y of[MASK]the subtribe which found that some species placed in Orbignya were actually more closely related to specie[MASK] placed in Sch[MASK]elea than they were to other m[MASK]mbers of that genus ( if the five @-@ genus approach was used ) , while A. crassispatha , placed in Orbi[MASK]nya by Glassman , was actually a sister to both Scheelea and Orbignya . 
 
 = = = History = = = 
 
 The genus Attalea was first described Carl[MASK]Si[MASK]ismund Ku[MASK]th in 1816 based on specimens[MASK]collected by Alexander von Humboldt and Aimé Bonpland , althoug[MASK] older , pre @[MASK]@ Linnaean description[MASK] exist , including Charles Plumi[MASK]r 's 1703 description of A. crassispat[MASK]a . The genus was nam[MASK]d for Attalus III Philometor , king of[MASK]Pergamon , known for his interest in medicinal plants . The type species is A. amygdalina , a Colombian endemic . The genera Maximil[MASK]ana and Orbignya were described by Carl Friedrich Philipp v[MASK]n Martius in 1826 and 1837 respectively . Sc[MASK]eelea was described by Hermann Karsten in 1857 , and Ynesa by Orator F. Cook in 1942 . 
 
 = = = Species = =[MASK]= 
 
 Experts disagree about the number of species in the genus Attalea ( broadly defined ) . In 1965 , Dutch taxonomis[MASK] Jan Gerard Wessel[MASK] Boer estimated that there may be as many as 100 species in the genus . In their 1996 Field Guide to the Palms of t[MASK]e Americas Andrew He[MASK]derson and coau[MASK]hors recognised 29 species in the genus , while Sidney Glassman recognised 65 species in his 1999 [MASK]reatment of the group . Largely following Glassman 's lead , Rafaël Govaerts and John Dransfield recognised 67 species in their 2005 World Checklist of Palms . An important element of this disagreement is the decision by Glassman to define species more narrowly than Henderson . As a result , what He[MASK]de[MASK]son interpreted as variation within species , Glassman took as differences between morphologicall[MASK] similar species . This prob[MASK]em is complicated by the fact that many of these species are poorly represented in herbarium collect[MASK]ons . The large size of [MASK]he leaves , inflorescences and fruit of many Attalea species makes them difficult[MASK]to coll[MASK]ct . In addition , many import[MASK]nt collections , including type specimen , have been lost or destroyed . Sparse or incomplete collections make it diffic[MASK]lt to differentiate var[MASK]ation wi[MASK]hin a single species fr[MASK]m variation between different species . 
 The three re[MASK]ent treatments ( Henderson and coauthors , Glassman , and Govaerts and Dransfield ) recognised a total of 73 species , but only 20 species [MASK]re accepted by all of them . The remainder account for ei[MASK]her nine species or more than 40 . For example , what Andrew Henderson considered a single species , Attalea attaleoides , other authors have considered a species comple[MASK] consisting of four or five species . Gl[MASK]ssman doubted the vali[MASK]ity of A. attaleoides as a species , and described four new specie[MASK][MASK]fr[MASK]m material [MASK]hat had previously been attributed to A. attaleoides — A. camopiensis , A. degranvillei , A. guianensis and A. [MASK]aripensis . Govaerts and Dransfield accepted both Glassman 's four species and A. attaleoides . However , Jean @-@ Ch[MASK]istophe [MASK]intaud was of the opinion that A. guianensis , A. maripensis and A. attaleoides were all very si[MASK]ilar , and thought it likely that they all represented the[MASK]same species . 
 Another species complex in Attalea includes A. speciosa and[MASK]related species . Henderson ( 1995 ) recognised A. speciosa and A. spectabilis , considering the latter to either be an acaulescent form of A. [MASK]peciosa or a hybrid between it and A. microcarpa . Govaerts and Dransfield accepted A. spectabilis , bu[MASK] Glassman considered it a dubious taxon . Attalea vitrivir was recognised as a distinct species by Michael Balick and coauthors ; Glassm[MASK]n and Govaerts and Dransfie[MASK]d concurred , but Henderson cons[MASK]dered it [MASK]art of A. speciosa . Glassman also described[MASK]a fou[MASK]th m[MASK]mber of t[MASK]is group , A. brejinhoensis , an[MASK] it is accepted by Govaerts and Dransfield . 
 
 = = Reproduction and growth = = 
 
 Attalea species[MASK]are monoecious — male and female flowers are separate , but are borne by the same plant . Various species have been described as being[MASK]insect @-@ pollinated , including A. phalerata ,[MASK]while pollination in A. colenda and A. speciosa , has been attributed both to [MASK]nsects and[MASK]wind . 
 Seed germination is remote tubular — during germ[MASK]nat[MASK]on , as the cotyle[MASK]on expands it pushes the young[MASK]shoot a[MASK]ay from the seed . After germination , the stem initially grows downw[MASK]rd before turning to grow u[MASK]ward and produce the aboveground stem [MASK] This produces a " saxo[MASK]hone shaped " belowground portion of the stem . The fact that the shoot t[MASK]ps of Attalea seedlings are un[MASK]erground it likely to c[MASK]ntribute to their fire @-@ tolera[MASK]ce . 
 
 = = Distribution = = 
 
 Species range across the Neotropics from Mexico in the north to[MASK]Bolivia , Paraguay , and south[MASK]rn Brazil in the south . Acc[MASK]rd[MASK]ng to Gov[MASK]e[MASK]ts and coauthors , three species are found in Mexico , four in Central [MASK]merica , and [MASK]2 in South America . Three species are [MASK]resent in the Caribbean — two in Trinidad and Tobago , along [MASK]he southern edge of the region , and one in H[MASK]iti . 
 
 = = Habitat and ecology = = 
 
 Attalea includes both large trees and small acaulescent palms which occupy a[MASK]number[MASK]of different ecological niches . Dense [MASK]tands of some of th[MASK] larger speci[MASK]s are conspicuous [MASK]lements on the landscape , while smaller species are found in both in the forest understorey and in savannas . 
 Disturbance has been implicated in the formation of vegetation dominated by large Attalea s[MASK]ecies . In seasonally dry Amazonian forests the de[MASK]sity of large adult A. maripa palms was correlated with canopy openness ; the species also dominates savannas [MASK]ormed by repeat[MASK]d forest fires in Trinidad and Tobago . Attalea speciosa forms pure[MASK]stands in many parts of Brazil where natural forest veg[MASK]tation has been clear[MASK]d . Similarly , stands of A. funifer[MASK] in Bahia[MASK], Braz[MASK]l ( which are cultivated for piassava fibre ) are managed using fire — the seedlings survive cuttin[MASK] and[MASK]burning , and a[MASK]e able to dominate burned forest patches . 
 The fruit are dispersed by animals ; fruit which are not dispersed frequently suffer seed [MASK]redation by bruchid beetles . Certain species of Attalea have been mentioned as [MASK]xamples of " anachro[MASK]istic " species which are[MASK]adapted for dispersal by now @-@ extinct Pleistocene meg[MASK]fauna . On Maracá Island , Roraima[MASK], in the Brazilian Amazon , Attalea [MASK]aripa fruit were consumed by tapirs , collared peccaries , deer and primates . Rodents , including agout[MASK]s , fed upon the fruit and , as the fruit availability declined , they fed on the seeds . [MASK]ther dispers[MASK]rs of Atta[MASK]ea fruit include Cre[MASK]ted Caracaras which consume the fruit and disperse the seeds of [MASK]. phalerata in the Braz[MASK]lian Pantanal . 
 
 = = Uses = = 
 
 Attalea spec[MASK]es h[MASK]ve a long history of human utilisation . Carbonised Attalea maripa s[MASK]eds h[MASK]ve been found in archaeological sites in Colombia dating back to 9000 BP . A variety of species remain important sources of e[MASK]ible oil , thatch , edible seeds and fibre . The leaves of Attalea butyrac[MASK]a and A. maripa are used extens[MASK]vely for thatc[MASK]ing . Several species are[MASK]oil palm[MASK] , with A. speciosa among the most important economically . P[MASK]oducts extracted from A. spe[MASK]iosa were reported to support over 300 @,@ 000 households in the Brazilian state of Maranhão in 2005 , and in 1985 it was estimated to s[MASK]pport over 450 @,@ 000 households throughout the Brazil . [MASK]i[MASK]ssava fibres , extracted from the leaf bases of A. funife[MASK]a , are commercially important , and [MASK]enera[MASK]ed about U[MASK] $ 20 million in annual income to Brazilian farmers in 1996 . 
 
 
 = Th[MASK] Heart of Ez[MASK]a Greer = 
 
 Th[MASK] Heart of Ezra Gr[MASK]er is a 1917 American silent d[MASK]ama film produced by [MASK]he[MASK]Thanhouser Company and direc[MASK]ed by Emil[MASK] Cha[MASK]tard . The film focuses on Ezra Greer , a successful middle @-[MASK] aged man who search[MASK]s for his college age daughter , Mary . The wayward Mary was romanced and abandoned by Jack Denbeigh , later bearing his child . Once Ezra becomes broke he finds employment as the valet for Jack Denbeigh . After Jack 's eng[MASK]gement to a cabaret girl , Mary becomes u[MASK]set and leaves her child at Jack 's home . Contrary to Jack 's wishes , Ezra keeps the child and Jack ultimately reveals that the child [MASK]s his o[MASK]n . Ezra convinces Jack to[MASK]make things right[MASK]and Ezra convinces the cabaret girl [MASK]o leave Jack . A[MASK]ter a carriage accident in which the baby is injured , Ezra and Jack rush to the hospital and find Mary as a nurse crying over the child . The film ends with the ma[MASK]riage of Jack a[MASK]d Mary . The film was released by Pathé on October 7 , 1917 . The film was the final release from Thanhouser and was deemed to be an average film by most reviewers . Criticism for the film hinged on far @-@ fetched coincidences to drive the plot . The film is presumed lost .

 = Free Derry = 
 
 [MASK]ree Derry ( Irish : Sao[MASK] Dhoire ) [MASK]as a self @-@ declared autonomous nationalist area of Derry , Northern Ireland , that ex[MASK]sted between 1969 and[MASK]19[MASK]2 . Its name [MASK]as taken from a sign painted on a gable wall in the Bogside in January 1969 which read , " You are now entering Free Derry " . The area , which included the Bogside and Creggan neighbourhoods , was secured by community activists for the first time on 5 January 1969 following an incursion into the Bogside by members of the Royal Ulster Constabulary ( RUC [MASK] . Residents built barricades and carried clubs and simil[MASK]r arms to prev[MASK]nt the RUC from entering .[MASK]After six days the residents [MASK]ook do[MASK]n the barricades an[MASK] RUC patrols resumed , but tensions remained high over the following month[MASK] . 
 Vio[MASK]ence reached a peak on 12 August 1969 , culminating in the Battle of the Bogsi[MASK]e — a three @-@ day pitched battle between residents and the RUC . On 14 August units of the British Army were deployed at the edge of the Bogside and the RUC were withdrawn . The Derry Citizens Defence Association ( DCDA ) declared their intention to hold the area against both the RUC [MASK]nd the British Army until their dema[MASK]ds were met . The British Army made no attempt to enter the area . The sit[MASK]ation continued un[MASK]il October 1969 [MASK]hen , following publication of the Hunt Report , military police were allowed in . 
 The[MASK]Irish Republican Army ( IRA ) began to re @-@[MASK]arm and recruit after Aug[MASK]st 1969 . In December 1[MASK]69 it split into the Official IRA and the Provisional IRA [MASK] [MASK]oth were supported by the [MASK]eople of the F[MASK]ee Derry area . Meanwhile , relations between the British Army and the nationalist community , which were initially g[MASK]od , deteriorated . In July 1971 there was a surge of recruitment into the IRA after two[MASK]young men were shot and killed by B[MASK]itish troops . The government introduced internment on 9 August 1971 , and[MASK]in re[MASK]ponse , barric[MASK]des went up once more in the Bogside and Creggan . This time , Free[MASK]Derry was a no @-@ go area , defended by armed members of bo[MASK]h the Official and Provisional IRA . From within the area they launched attacks on the British Army , and the Provisionals began a bombing ca[MASK]paign in the city centre . As before , unarmed ' auxiliaries ' manned t[MASK]e barricades , and crime was dealt with by a voluntary body known as the Free Derry Police . 
 Support for the IRA increased further after Bloody Sunday in January 1972 , when thirteen unarmed m[MASK]n and bo[MASK]s were shot dead [MASK]y the British Army 's Parachute Regiment at a march in the Bogside ( a 14th man was wounded and died 4 ½ months later ) . The support began t[MASK] wane after the killing by the Officia[MASK] IRA of a local y[MASK]uth who wa[MASK] home on leave from t[MASK]e British Army . After a Provisional IRA ceasefire , during which it entered talks with the British governmen[MASK] , broke down , th[MASK] British took the decision to move against [MASK]he " no @-@ go " areas . Free Derry came to an end on 31 July 1972 , when thousands of British troops moved in with armoured cars and b[MASK]lldozers to occupy the area . 
 
 = = B[MASK]ckground = = 
 
 Derry City lies near the border between Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland . It has a majority nationalist population , and nationalists won a majority of seats in the 1920 l[MASK]cal elections . Despite this , the Ulster Unionist Party con[MASK]rolled the local cou[MASK]cil , Londonderry Corporation ,[MASK]from 1923 onwar[MASK]s . The [MASK]nionists maintained thei[MASK] majority , firstly[MASK], [MASK]y manipulating the constituency boundaries ( gerrymandering ) so that the Sou[MASK]h Ward , with a nationalist majority , returned eight councillors while the much smaller North Ward and Waterside Ward , with unionist majorities , returned[MASK]tw[MASK]lve councill[MASK]rs be[MASK]ween[MASK]them ; secondly , by allowing on[MASK]y ratepayers to v[MASK]te[MASK]in local elections , rather than one man , one vote , so that a higher number of nationalists[MASK], who did not own homes , were disenfranchised ; an[MASK] thirdly , by denyi[MASK][MASK] houses to nationalists outsid[MASK] the South Ward c[MASK]nstituency . The resul[MASK] was that there were about 2 [MASK],@ 000 nationalist fa[MASK]ilies , and practically[MASK]no unionists , on the housing waiting list , and that housing in the nationalist area was crowded and of a very po[MASK]r condition . The South Ward comprised[MASK]the Bogside , Brandywell , Creggan , Bishop Street and Foyle Road , and it[MASK]was this area that would become Free Derry . 
 The Derry Housing Action Committee ([MASK]DHAC ) was formed in March 1968 by members of the Derry Branch of the Northern Ireland Labour Party and the [MASK]ames Connolly Republican Club , i[MASK]cluding Eamonn McCann and Eamon Mela[MASK]gh . It disrupted a meeting of Londonderry Corporation in March 1968 and in [MASK]ay blocked traffic by[MASK]placing a caravan that was home to a family of four in the middle of the Lecky Road in the Bogs[MASK]de a[MASK]d sta[MASK]ing a si[MASK] @-@ down protest at [MASK]he opening of the second deck o[MASK] the Craigavon Bridge . After the meeting of Londonderry Corporation was again disrupted in Augus[MASK] , Eamon Melaugh telep[MASK]oned the Northern Ireland Civil Rights Association ( NICRA ) and invited them to hold a march[MASK]in Derry . The date chosen was 5 October 1968 , an adhoc committee was formed ( although [MASK]n reality most of the organ[MASK]zin[MASK] was done[MASK]by McCann and Melaugh ) and the [MASK]ou[MASK]e w[MASK]s to take the marc[MASK]ers inside the city walls , where nationalis[MASK]s were traditionally not permitted to ma[MASK]ch . The Ministe[MASK] of Home[MASK]Affairs , William [MASK]raig , made an order on 3 October prohibiting the m[MASK]rch on the grounds that the App[MASK]entice Boys of Derry were intending to hold a march on the sa[MASK]e day . In the words of Martin Melaugh of CAIN " this particular tactic ... provided the[MASK]ex[MASK]use[MASK]needed to ban t[MASK]e [MASK]arch . " When the marchers attempted to defy t[MASK]e ban on[MASK]5 October they were stopped by a Royal U[MASK]ster Constabulary ( RUC ) cordon . The police drew their batons and struc[MASK] marchers , including Stormont MP Eddie McAteer[MASK]and Westminster MP Gerry Fitt . Subsequen[MASK]ly the police " broke ranks and used their batons indiscriminately on people in Duke Street " . Marchers trying to esc[MASK]pe met another party of police[MASK][MASK]nd " [MASK]hese police also used their batons indis[MASK]riminately . " Water cannons were also used . The police action caused outrage in the nationalist area of Derry , and at a meeting four[MASK]days later [MASK]he Derry Citizens ' Action Committee ( DCAC ) was formed , with John Hume as c[MASK]air[MASK]an and Ivan Cooper as vice @-@ chairman . 
 
 = = The first barri[MASK]ade[MASK] = = 
 
 Another group formed as a result of the even[MASK]s of 5 October was People 's Democracy , a group of students in Queen 's University Belfast [MASK] They organised a march from [MASK]elfast to Derry in support of civil [MASK]ights , starting out with about forty y[MASK]ung pe[MASK]ple on 1 January 1969 . The police , who were at the sce[MASK]e , c[MASK]atted to the B @-@ Specials as[MASK]they prepared their ambush , and then failed to protect the marchers , many of whom ran into the[MASK]river and were pelted with stones from the bank . [MASK]ioting [MASK]roke out after the rally . Police drove rioters into the Bogside , but did not come after them .  [MASK]hat afternoon over 1 @,@ 500 Bogside residents built barricades , armed themselves with steel bars , wooden [MASK]lubs and hurleys , and told the police th[MASK]t they would not be allowed into t[MASK]e area .  [MASK] = = April 1969 = = 
 
 Over the next three [MASK]onths there were violent clashes , with local youths throwing stones at police . Violence came to a head on Satur[MASK]ay , 19 April after a planned march from Burntollet Bridge to the city centre was banned . Devenny was brought to hospital " bleeding profusely from a number of head wounds . "[MASK]At midnight four hundred RUC men in full riot gear and carrying riot shields occupied the Bogside . Convoys of police vehicles drove through the area with headlights blazing . 
 The following day , several th[MASK]usand[MASK]residents , led by the DCAC , withdrew to the[MASK]Creggan and [MASK]ssued an ultimatum to[MASK]the RUC — withdraw within tw[MASK] hours or[MASK]be [MASK]riv[MASK]n out .  Samuel Devenny s[MASK]ffered a heart attack four days after his beating . On 17 July he suffered a further heart attack and died .
